chunks.title: Ask i95Dev on Any eCommerce Related Queries | i95Dev FAQ

headings.text: Ask i95Dev on Any eCommerce Related Queries | i95Dev FAQ

chunks.content: Ask i95Dev on Any eCommerce Related Queries | i95Dev FAQ Ask i95Dev # Frequently Asked Questions Explore answers to the most frequently asked questions about i95Dev. Get clarity on our solutions, support, and implementation process. How is i95Dev’s Integrated eCommerce different from other eCommerce solutions? i95Dev’s, Integrated eCommerce solution- Ecommerce Growth Engine (EGE) is a way different from any other solution in the market. Two main areas of differentiation: Read More Are your connectors certified by the eCommerce platforms that you provide? Yes, all our connectors Microsoft Dynamics are Magento Certified . Moreover, i95Dev Connectors are also listed on the Magento Marketplace with outstanding customer reviews and prices like no other…. Read More Can you integrate Magento with my ERP or POS system? Consider the below to select the right Magento development company: Expertise : Make sure the Magento Development Company you select holds the expertise requires in the field of eCommerce as well as the industry you serve… Read More Will the eCommerce platform help in achieving more success when compared to eCommerce marketplaces? Both, selling on eCommerce marketplaces and on your eStore are profitable. Each one of these has its own advantages and disadvantages… Read More What does an effective eCommerce site look like? An effective website is much more than one which visually appeals to customers… Read More Why should we partner with i95Dev? i95Dev is a one-stop-shop for all your eCommerce needs. Expert in both B2B and B2C businesses. An eCommerce and integration technology partner that empowers businesses across the globe with Magento and its Microsoft Dynamics ERP integration products and much more… Read More How long does it take to implement your eCommerce platform? With our kind of expertise and experience in the eCommerce industry for over two decades, your online store goes live in just 8 weeks with no last-minute surprises… Read More To what extent can I customize my online store? It is possible to carry out customizations provided you select SaaS. However, currently, not everything can be customized except the areas of the software that presently have extensions available – shipping, … Read More How easily can I add an eCommerce search experience into my web store? This purely depends on the eCommerce solution you have chosen. Although, many of the online store software solutions have built-in search features… Read More What are the product attributes that customers can search for? Title, color, rich product description, item number and size Is the tool capable of scanning non-Magento pages on my online store? Scanning non-Magento pages for vulnerabilities with the help of the Magento Security Scan Tool can lead to unreliable results as it is designed to scan vulnerabilities on Magento domains. Therefore, we recommend you not to use the tool for scanning non-Magento pages. Ask i95Dev If you have any questions or queries then please feel free to drop us a message. 131 Continental Dr, Suite 305, Newark, DE 19713 info@i95dev.com (301) 760-7499 Interested In eCommerce Store Development/ Upgrade ERP Integrated eCommerce ERP/ Accounting Integration Support and Maintenance Cloud Services Digital Marketing Other Prefer to choose a time? Book a meeting with our expert.

chunks.title: eCommerce News & Insights

headings.text: eCommerce News & Insights

chunks.content: News # eCommerce News & Insights Stay updated with the latest trends, innovations, and success stories shaping the world of eCommerce. Discover what’s new and what’s next in the digital commerce space. Ecommerce Insight Shopify’s Agentic Commerce & Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP) Shopify’s agentic commerce platform and Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP) introduce an open standard for enabling seamless AI-powered shopping experiences across major AI interfaces, letting merchants sell directly through conversational channels like Google AI Mode, Gemini, and Microsoft Copilot. Commerce Innovation Google & Shopify’s Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP) and the Future of AI-Led eCommerce Google and Shopify’s Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP) introduces a new open standard for agentic commerce, enabling seamless shopping experiences across AI-powered platforms and conversational interfaces. AI & Ecommerce Insight ChatGPT Ads & eCommerce Discovery — Opportunity or Costly Distraction? OpenAI will begin testing ads in ChatGPT for free and Go users in the U.S., marking a shift toward AI-driven monetization. The move raises questions about how ads may impact ecommerce discovery and user experience, while paid plans remain ad-free. Market Insight How OpenAI’s ChatGPT App Store Is Shaping the Future of Conversational Commerce OpenAI has launched the ChatGPT App Store — a built-in app directory within ChatGPT that lets developers publish apps and users access third-party tools seamlessly within conversations. This move transforms ChatGPT into a broader platform ecosystem with expanded capabilities. URGENT Security Advisory SessionReaper (CVE-2025-54236) – Adobe Commerce & Magento Open-Source A newly discovered critical vulnerability, SessionReaper (CVE-2025-54236), impacts Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source. This flaw allows account takeover without user interaction through the Commerce REST API and has been rated 9.1/10 Critical on the National Vulnerability Database (NVD). Subscribe to Our i95Dev Join our community of finance, operations, and procurement experts

chunks.content: The ERP eCommerce Integration Journey Join our ERP eCommerce Integration Series to explore best practices, real-world strategies, and expert insights. Learn how to streamline operations, connect systems seamlessly, and grow your business with powerful ERP–eCommerce integrations. Get Started Learn Connect Grow – ERP eCommerce Integration Series Integration is the nerve center of a connected eCommerce eco-system. It builds the much needed flexibility and scalability into the system. Understanding these needs and planning accordingly is vital for the success of an eCommerce business. Our integration series is built around purpose to sensitize eCommerce players through a fixed regime of emails. Go ahead and subscribe to our series to build your knowledge base on the much-needed understanding of your eco-system. headings.text: Supercharge Business Growth with eCommerce & Integration | i95Dev Webinar

chunks.content: Supercharge Business Growth with eCommerce & Integration | i95Dev Webinar Product # Unlock the Power of eCommerce & Integration With the ever evolving customer expectations and rapidly changing technology, eCommerce business can be challenging. With i95Dev, discover the secrets to drive growth, efficiency, stand out from your competition, and more. Watch on Demand The eCommerce Insider Series: eCommerce Secrets for Online Success Unveiled Introducing the eCommerce + Integration Webinar Series, where we will dive deep into the world of eCommerce, uncovering the strategies, solutions, best practices, and pro-tips we have amassed over the past 10+ years. Prepare to be inspired by real-life success stories from businesses just like yours, who have harnessed the power of eCommerce and integration to transform their business. So, what are you waiting for? Register now to unlock the secrets, embark on a transformative journey, and let us guide you towards unparalleled success. Webinars Proven strategies to improve CX with eCommerce and integration Are you ready to discover the secrets of creating an unforgettable customer experience? Learn how eCommerce and integration can transform your business in our informative webinar. Explore real-life case studies, gain valuable insights, and learn best practices to maximize your eCommerce success. Watch on Demand One Platform, Infinite Sales: Navigating Multichannel eCommerce with Integration Unleash the power of multichannel selling. Join our webinar series to learn how to reach a wider audience, provide seamless shopping experiences, diversify revenue streams, improve search engine visibility, and adapt to changing customer behavior. Don’t limit yourself to a single sales channel. Watch on Demand B2B Businesses: How to Survive in the Digital Age Digital transformation is essential for B2B companies. Supercharge your B2B business with eCommerce and integration! Join our webinar to explore the power of a comprehensive digital platform, scaling up effectively, and overcoming key challenges. Discover the secrets of B2B eCommerce success through real-world use cases. Watch on Demand Retail Resilience: Conquering Challenges with eCommerce and Integration Unlock the key to retail success in our engaging webinar! Are you facing fierce competition from online retailers? Learn how to strengthen your online presence, conquer marketplace challenges, optimize the customer journey, and streamline operations. Join us now to transform your retail business and stay ahead in the game! Watch on Demand Wheels of Innovation: Addressing Automotive Industry Challenges with eCommerce and Integration Challenges and opportunities have never been more intertwined for automotive businesses. Join our webinar to tackle industry challenges, learn from success stories, and steer into an eCommerce-driven future. Watch on Demand Dive into the Dynamic World of eCommerce. Home Décor and Furniture Industry Are you involved in the home improvement industry? Whether you’re a retailer, contractor, supplier, or manufacturer, our podcast is designed to help you navigate the rapidly evolving world of eCommerce. chunks.title: About Us

headings.text: About Us

chunks.content: Passionate About eCommerce “eCommerce has revolutionized the way we do business, the way we approach markets, and the way we service our customers. We love eCommerce for its incredible potential to impact the lives of both businesses (small or big) and customers (b2b or b2c). We are proud to be a part of such an incredible journey, helping businesses set up their eCommerce stores. We are passionate about eCommerce and hold ourselves accountable to deliver the best for our client, every time, every day.” – Vanit Kumar Founder and CEO Our Clients Fechheimer albawardi bandai-namco bedgear bvvins boa ikea jaipurliving mossberg nespresso xiaomi valextra usb southindia shrm shockdoctor shinola noritake #Vision Empowering Business, People, and Society We aim to deliver world-class services, products, and technology that enable businesses to grow, empower individuals to achieve more, and positively impact society as a whole. Values i95Dev is an eCommerce thought leader and next generation eCommerce capacity-building company with services extending across North America, Australia and India. The journey that started with 4 individuals offering software and web development services has brought i95Dev to a well etched-out niche, a robust eCommerce and integration services company. Today, i95Dev specializes in designing, developing and maintaining B2B/B2C omni-channel eCommerce ecosystems in Adobe Commerce with over 200+ clients across Retail, Manufacturing, Distribution, and Wholesale Trade. We believe that this is only a beginning to what we envisioned. headings.text: Culture and Careers – i95dev

chunks.content: Culture at i95Dev At i95Dev, we value people and appreciate their contribution. Learning passionately and growing exponentially are the core aspects of our work culture. We believe in providing everyone with the opportunity to initiate change and grow as a professional. Hearing out new ideas and opinions, promoting openness, and encouraging our employees to live by the values they believe in, define us. Our workplace has a safe, welcoming, and positive environment where healthy relationships are nurtured and festivities are relished to the fullest. Join Our Team Values i95Dev is an eCommerce thought leader and next generation eCommerce capacity-building company with services extending across North America, Australia and India. The journey that started with 4 individuals offering software and web development services has brought i95Dev to a well etched-out niche, a robust eCommerce and integration services company. Integrity We are trustworthy and dependable. We practice open and honest communication and take full responsibility for our actions. Customer Delight We always surprise our customers by exceeding their expectations. Our goal is to keep them happy and satisfied. Quality We never comprise on our quality of work. Delivering exactly what the client wants and striving to do the best is what keeps us ahead of the rest. Team Work We believe teamwork is important for the success of our business. It helps us generate new ideas, overcome challenges, and develop mutual respect. Equal Opportunity We believe in providing equal opportunity to one and all. Everyone in our organization shares equal benefits of learning, honing skills, growing, and bringing their ideas to the table. Why I love i95Dev Slide 4 Grateful for the Journey: My Growth with i95Dev I take immense pride in being a part of the i95Dev family. My career took off with the growth of the company. The invaluable knowledge that I have acquired in my journey will be cherished forever. I am grateful to work in a company that encourages your ideas, appreciates your effort, and helps you grow. - Software Engineer Slide 4 Endless Opportunities and Growth: My Experience at i95Dev The company provides you with lots of opportunities to prove your potential and grow. The place has a good work-life balance. It has been an educational and fun-filled experience so far and I look forward to many more years of learning at i95Dev. - Sales Executive Slide 4 Rewarding Growth and Learning: My Journey at i95Dev I have spent the most rewarding years of my career at i95Dev. The company takes very good care of employee welfare and growth. I can categorically say that my journey has been full of learning experiences. Great place to work! - Business Analyst Culture at i95Dev Join Our Team Global Openings At i95Dev, we believe in nurturing talent across the globe, offering exciting career opportunities that span multiple regions and industries. Whether you’re an expert in technology, sales, marketing, or customer support, our global openings provide a chance to work with a dynamic, innovative team committed to excellence. headings.text: Multi Channel Sales with Integrated eCommerce Made Easy | i95Dev

chunks.content: Multi Channel Sales with Integrated eCommerce Made Easy | i95Dev Use Case# Multi-Channel Sales Made Easy Easily manage and grow your business with seamless multi-channel sales. Connect and sell across platforms like Amazon, eBay, Shopify, and more—all from one place. Streamline inventory, orders, and customer data for a smooth, unified experience. Save time, boost sales, and stay in control effortlessly. Tell me More The challenges associated with selling across multiple channels With the growing popularity of online marketplaces, most businesses are compelled to sell on them, in addition to their own eCommerce store, to cater to their customers and grow at a faster pace while keeping up with the competitors. However, selling across multiple channels can present multiple challenges. Sales Surge Manage the increased demand in sales Best Practices Meet the guidelines and best practices recommended by the marketplaces Catalog Sync Manage product and inventory information across channels Shipping Sync Streamline order fulfillment and shipping updates Review Management Manage customer expectations and reviews across channels Process Alignment Streamline business processes to accommodate channel-specific workflows ProAudiostar is New York City’s go-to spot and its largest independent dealer. Located in the heart of the Brooklyn music scene since 2006, ProAudioStar is known for its passion for music and specializes in music equipment. In the beginning, they had started with an eBay store and quickly added their own eCommerce store. They had plans to expand their reach to Amazon, Walmart, and other marketplace platforms. Then they hit the wall. While multi-channel sales boosted their business, they also saw cracks in their supply chain, inventory management, and order fulfillment, leading to poor customer experience. That’s when they called i95Dev, a leader in eCommerce systems implementation. Collaborating with i95Dev i95Dev experts conducted in-depth research on ProAudioStar’s current systems and business processes. Many significant loopholes were uncovered during the discovery sessions that blocked their way to success. Integrated Automation i95Dev helped ProAudioStar management solve the above problems by creating an integrated commerce ecosystem to automate the all business processes. Seamless Efficiency The integrated ecosystem enabled end-to-end automation that saved time, money, and effort. Automated Sync Product, order, shipment, etc., information was auto-synced between their eCommerce store, online marketplace, ERP system, and the shipping services provider. Scalable Growth Automation allowed ProAudioStar to put everything on auto-pilot, which gave them the confidence to add Amazon, Walmart, and Reverb sales channels to the integrated commerce ecosystem to drive their growth further. Advantages of collaborating with us Partnering with us means access to expert support, cutting-edge tools, and streamlined multi-channel solutions. chunks.title: Manage B2B and B2C Customers with Unified eCommerce | i95Dev

headings.text: Manage B2B and B2C Customers with Unified eCommerce | i95Dev

chunks.content: Manage B2B and B2C Customers with Unified eCommerce | i95Dev Use Case# Manage B2B and B2C Customers with Ease Efficiently manage both B2B and B2C customers through a unified platform that simplifies customer segmentation, pricing, and order processing. Tailor experiences based on customer type, ensuring personalized service and smooth transactions. This approach enhances customer satisfaction and streamlines business operations across diverse buyer groups. Tell me More Challenges businesses face while managing B2B and B2C customers at the same time Many companies find it difficult to manage B2B and B2C customers equally. If not done right, it affects customer satisfaction and overall business growth. Platform Divide The eCommerce or ERP platforms are incapable of handing B2B and B2C customers together. Order Overlap Orders coming in from multiple sources lead to the inability to differentiate unique entries. Process Mismatch Both B2B and B2C business processes demand an individual set of features and privileges. If not done right, it leads to unsatisfied customers. Pricing Disparity The pricing structure for B2B customers is way different than B2C customers. Inventory Chaos Inventory management becomes chaos if the orders and the associated warehouse stocks are not well organized. Manual Sorting Hours of human efforts are required to sort the B2B and B2C customers. A leading brand dealing with rugs and home decor fabric designs worldwide. Established in 1998, Jaipur Living produces a wide collection of products, well known in the US, Canada, Mexico, and the Caribbean market. Jaipur Living, too faced similar issues while managing their B2B and B2C customers, which hampered their customer experience and overall growth. Collaborating with i95Dev i95Dev experts conducted a thorough discovery session with their team to understand the platforms, business processes, customers, etc. An ERP integration was suggested where i95Dev implemented its Microsoft Dynamics NAV Connector to overcome the challenges. Magento Capability Firstly i95Dev’s team made them aware that Magento has 100% capacity to handle both B2B and B2C customers effectively. Customer Enablement Though the two types of customers required a different set of features, the need was to understand the ability of Magento to cater to these customers uniquely. i95Dev provided the necessary training to make the utmost use of the platforms involved. Integration Gap i95Dev experts suggested the challenges faced in pricing, order, and inventory management, were because of the lack of integration between Microsoft Dynamics NAV and Magento. Seamless Integration ERP integration with Magento with i95Dev’s Connector eliminated duplicate customer entries thereby reducing hours of manual work and eliminating human errors. Custom Pricing i95Dev Connector’s Customer Specific Pricing feature offered pricing by customers and item discount pricing. This feature solved the problem of assigning prices and discounts basis different customers, items, customers groups, and item groups. In addition to this, i95Dev also customized a pricing feature where discounts can be applied as salesperson Discount % or CSR Discount. Order Sync For order management, i95Dev provided a solution that allowed bi-directional sync of orders from Magento e-store to NAV and vice-versa. This resulted in keeping both the systems updated at one go therefore eliminating manual work, wrong, duplicate orders, and saving transport costs. Advantages of collaborating with us Partnering with us means access to expert support, cutting-edge tools, and streamlined multi-channel solutions. We help you save time, reduce hassle, and grow your sales efficiently across all major platforms. Customer Clarity Easy management of B2B and B2C customers. Experience Enhancement Optimized B2B customer experience. Order Segmentation Differentiation between orders from multiple B2B and B2C sources. Feature Customization B2B and B2C specific features. Operational Perfection 100% flawless operational efficiency. Automated Precision Close to zero human intervention with 100% accuracy and automation. Seamless Orders Error-free order management for B2B and B2C customers with diverse business processes. Do you also find it challenging to manage both your B2B and B2C customers? If yes, reach out to us today. No need to lose your sleep over it. Trusted Globally Trusted by 400+ businesses across 25+ industries across 15+ countries. chunks.title: How to Choose the Right Adobe Commerce Partner in North America? - i95Dev

headings.text: How to Choose the Right Adobe Commerce Partner in North America? - i95Dev

chunks.content: How to Choose the Right Adobe Commerce Partner in North America? - i95Dev How to Choose the Right Adobe Commerce Partner in North America? Author Category Share A monumental player in the eCommerce industry, Adobe Commerce (formerly Magento) stands within the Adobe Experience Suite as a powerhouse, endowing online retailers with a robust platform and an extensive toolkit to craft distinctive solutions. Yet, navigating the intricacies of this platform isn’t always straightforward, leaving business owners in search of adept guidance. Herein lies the essence of professional advice. By synergizing pre-existing Magento capabilities with your unique concepts, you can mold your ideal online storefront—with the support of a seasoned eCommerce agency. However, the challenge emerges when confronted with a multitude of Adobe Commerce (Magento Enterprise) partners in the market, leaving one with the daunting task of selecting the right fit for their venture. The question that arises: How does one pinpoint the optimal Adobe Commerce Partner in North America? To aid in this pivotal decision-making process, we have meticulously laid the groundwork to ensure no stone remains unturned. In this blog, you’ll unearth knowledgeable Adobe Commerce partners tailored to your eCommerce endeavors in North America. But first, let’s delve into Adobe Commerce as an eCommerce platform. Exploring the Adobe Commerce (Magento) Platform Renowned for its versatility and potency, Adobe Commerce (Magento) is a dynamic eCommerce platform that empowers businesses to create and manage online stores. Engineered to offer flexibility, scalability, and a gamut of features, it caters to the needs of both small and large enterprises. Choosing the Ideal Adobe Commerce Partner in North America Unlocking the vibrant North America B2C and B2B Adobe Commerce partner ecosystem necessitates an alliance with proven solutions and expertise. Partners can be instrumental in catalyzing business transformation through design, implementation, support, and customized merchandising services that align with your goals. However, amidst a plethora of options, selectivity becomes paramount. Begin by determining whether a Solution Partner or a Technology Partner suits your needs. Criteria for Selecting the Right Adobe Commerce (Magento) Partner in North America Selecting the ideal Adobe Commerce Partner necessitates strategic consideration of the following criteria: 1. Assess Your Requirements: Gauge the size, complexity, budget, and unique features of your eCommerce project to align with the partner’s capabilities. Before embarking on your search for the perfect Adobe Commerce Partner, it’s imperative to embark on a comprehensive evaluation of your project’s requirements. Consider the scope and scale of your eCommerce venture—are you looking to establish a small boutique or a large-scale marketplace? Analyze the complexity of the features you envision for your online store, whether it involves intricate customization or specialized functionalities. Delve into your budget constraints to understand the financial feasibility of the partnership. Furthermore, identify the unique attributes that set your business apart—these could range from niche products to unconventional customer engagement strategies. Aligning your project’s intricacies with the partner’s expertise is paramount for a fruitful collaboration. Download i95Dev eCommerce requirement template now Click here Impact: Inadequate Solutions: Failing to match partner capabilities with project complexity and unique features can lead to incomplete or mismatched solutions. This results in poor user experience, limited scalability, and difficulties in adapting as your business grows. Budget Overruns: Inaccurate budget considerations can lead to unexpected costs and financial strain. Without proper alignment, you might face budget overruns, potentially leaving your project unfinished or compromising its quality. Project Delays and Frustration: Incorrectly assessing project needs can cause miscommunication and delays. This leads to frustration, missed milestones, and extended timelines, impacting your business’s ability to launch on schedule and meet crucial sales periods. 2. Evaluate Expertise and Experience: Scrutinize portfolios, case studies, and testimonials for a partner’s proficiency in developing and managing Magento-powered websites. The proof of proficiency lies in the portfolio and case studies . Thoroughly review the partner’s past projects, assessing the diversity and quality of the websites they’ve developed on the Magento platform. Delve into case studies that shed light on how they’ve tackled challenges and delivered successful outcomes for their clients. Ø Platform Expertise and Experience: Assessing a potential Adobe Commerce partner’s proficiency in working with the platform is foundational to your project’s success. Scrutinize their track record, portfolio, and references specifically related to Adobe Commerce. Magento/Adobe Commerce Portfolio: Review their portfolio of past Adobe Commerce projects. Look for a variety of projects that showcase their understanding of different aspects of the platform, such as customizations, integrations, and performance optimization. Client Testimonials and Case Studies: Seek out testimonials and detailed case studies from clients they’ve worked with. These testimonials offer insights into their ability to deliver on promises, meet deadlines, and provide a positive client experience. Ø Industry Expertise and Experience: An Adobe Commerce partner’s familiarity with your industry is vital for tailored solutions that resonate with your target audience and business goals. Industry-Relevant Projects: Evaluate whether the partner has experience working within your industry. Partners with a history of successful projects within your sector can bring valuable insights and best practices to the table. Understanding of Industry Challenges: Gauge their understanding of your industry’s unique challenges and pain points. An adept partner should be able to identify potential hurdles and propose effective solutions. Ø B2B Expertise and Experience (if applicable): For B2B businesses, specialized expertise in business-to-business eCommerce dynamics is crucial. B2B eCommerce Focus: Examine whether the partner has a dedicated focus on B2B eCommerce. B2B transactions often involve complex workflows, integration needs, and customer segmentation, requiring specialized expertise. Complexity Handling: Delve into their experience with handling the intricacies of B2B eCommerce, such as handling bulk orders, tiered pricing, custom catalogs, and account management features. Learn how i95Dev’s eCommerce with integration capabilities in our On- Demand webinar series Click here Impact: Supar Performance: Partnering with a provider lacking adequate experience in Magento development might result in substandard websites. This can lead to slow loading times, glitches, and poor user experiences, ultimately deterring potential customers. Maintenance Challenges: Without a skilled partner, your website may require frequent fixes and updates, leading to ongoing expenses and disruptions. An inexperienced partner might struggle to maintain the website effectively, impacting its stability and performance. Limited Scalability: Inadequate expertise can result in websites that aren’t built for scalability. As your business grows, the website might struggle to handle increased traffic and transactions, hampering your expansion plans 3. Certification and Partnership Status: Verify the partner’s certification and partnership level with Magento to ensure their dedication and competence. The journey of a Magento Partner is marked by certifications and partnership tiers. These accolades signify not only expertise but also the commitment of the partner to the Magento platform. Scrutinize the partner’s certification portfolio to ascertain that they possess the necessary skills to navigate Magento’s intricacies. Moreover, delve into their partnership level, as it reflects the depth of their engagement with Magento. Partnerships are segmented into levels such as Solution Partner, Select Partner, and Business Partner, each signifying a varying degree of expertise. A higher partnership status underscores their dedication, proficiency, and alignment with Magento’s standards. Impact: Risk of Errors: Inexperienced or uncertified partners are more likely to make errors in development, customization, and maintenance. These mistakes can lead to functionality issues, security vulnerabilities, and potential data breaches. Inadequate Expertise: Partnering with an uncertified or lower-tier partner might mean working with professionals lacking the necessary skills. This can result in suboptimal solutions, poor website performance, and limitations in leveraging Magento’s full potential. Limited Support: Lower-tier partners might lack access to essential resources and support from Magento. This could lead to longer response times for addressing issues, hindering your ability to maintain a seamless online presence. 4. Range of Services: Confirm if the partner offers end-to-end services, including design, development, integration, customization, and ongoing support, diverse skill sets Your Adobe Commerce Partner should be your comprehensive ally. Confirm that their services span the entire spectrum of your project’s lifecycle. Starting from the initial design phase, they should offer insights and solutions that harmonize with your brand identity and customer expectations. Development capabilities should encompass intricate coding and feature implementation, ensuring your online store is functional and user-friendly. Integration expertise becomes paramount for seamless interactions between various systems and tools. The capacity for customization is vital for tailoring your store to your unique business model. Ongoing support and maintenance should be part of their commitment, guaranteeing that your store remains optimized and glitch-free even after the initial launch. Diverse Skillsets and Expertise: A capable partner brings together diverse skillsets to create a well-rounded team. Their solution architects craft a strategic roadmap that aligns with your brand identity and customer expectations. Business analysts translate your business goals into technical solutions that drive impactful outcomes. Development Proficiency: Development capabilities are pivotal for turning design concepts into functional reality. The partner’s development team, armed with intricate coding skills, ensures seamless feature implementation that makes your online store not only visually appealing but also functional and user-friendly. Journey with i95Dev Impact: Fragmented Solutions: Choosing a partner with limited services may result in fragmented solutions. This can lead to compatibility issues, disjointed user experiences, and a lack of cohesive branding across your eCommerce platform. Integration Challenges: If a partner lacks integration services, you might struggle to connect your eCommerce platform with essential business tools such as CRMs, ERPs, and payment gateways. This can hinder efficient operations and customer interactions. Limited Adaptability: Without a partner offering comprehensive services, your website might lack the adaptability required for changing business needs. This can hinder your ability to quickly implement new features or respond to market shifts. Functionality Gaps: Inadequate development capabilities may lead to functionality gaps and technical issues within your Adobe Commerce platform. This can result in a website that doesn’t function properly, leading to frustrated users and lost sales. 5. Client Support and Communication: Gauge communication channels, responsiveness, and post-project support. Effective communication forms the backbone of any successful partnership. Evaluate how the partner facilitates communication—do they provide multiple channels for easy interaction and updates? Responsiveness is a key indicator of their commitment to your project’s success. A partner who promptly addresses your queries and concerns is more likely to deliver a smooth and efficient collaboration. Equally crucial is post-project support. After your online store is launched, you might encounter minor hiccups or require adjustments. Confirm that the partner offers reliable post-launch support to ensure your store’s continuous optimal performance. Incorporating these detailed assessments into your search for the right Adobe Commerce Partner empowers you to make an informed and strategic decision. Remember, the partner you choose becomes an integral extension of your business, influencing the trajectory of your eCommerce venture’s success. Impact: Lack of Post-Project Support: Partnering with a provider that doesn’t offer robust post-project support can leave you stranded when issues arise after launch. This can lead to prolonged disruptions and lost revenue if problems aren’t resolved promptly. Missed Growth Opportunities: A partner that doesn’t stay in touch and provide ongoing support might miss opportunities to enhance your eCommerce platform as your business evolves. This can hinder your ability to adapt to market changes and customer preferences Delayed Issue Resolution: Without a partner committed to responsiveness, you might encounter delays in addressing technical issues and resolving critical problems. This can result in extended periods of downtime, affecting your sales and customer trust. 6. Local presence: Understand local market, cultural alignment, time-zone advantage, site performance. A partner with local presence is more likely to have a deep understanding of the local market dynamics, trends, and consumer behaviors. This insight is invaluable when tailoring your eCommerce platform to match regional preferences and needs. Being in the same time zone reduces communication delays and ensures prompt responses. This is particularly important for resolving urgent issues, especially during critical phases of your eCommerce project. Geographic proximity can positively impact website performance, especially when it comes to server response times and loading speeds. A local partner can optimize your site’s performance for the local audience. In summary, a local presence can provide unique insights, cultural alignment, and efficient collaboration that contribute to the success of your Adobe Commerce project. It ensures that your partner understands the local landscape and can tailor solutions that resonate with your target audience. Impact: Suboptimal Performance: Geographic distance might impact website performance, resulting in slower loading times for users in the region. This can lead to higher bounce rates and decreased user satisfaction. Limited Local Insights: Without a local partner’s insights, your eCommerce platform might lack the fine-tuned strategies necessary to capture the local market’s attention and drive conversions. Missed Cultural Relevance: A partner without local presence might overlook cultural nuances and preferences, leading to a disconnected user experience that fails to resonate with the local audience. 7. Strategic Considerations: Project Timeline and Costing – Budget alignment and feasebility, the value of the investment, ability and future cost When selecting the ideal Adobe Commerce partner, an integrated assessment of project timeline and costing is paramount. These two facets are intertwined, influencing the trajectory of your eCommerce venture. An optimal project timeline ensures that your business objectives are met within the desired timeframe, while prudent costing safeguards financial health. Balancing these factors fosters resource allocation for quality output, and transparency in costing practices builds trust. As you evaluate potential partners, their proposed timeline and costing should be aligned with your vision and budget, forging a partnership poised for both efficient delivery and financial viability. Impact Project Delays: Without a well-defined project timeline, there’s a higher risk of project delays. This can lead to missed opportunities, postponed revenue generation, and increased frustration among stakeholders. Budget Overruns: Ignoring cost considerations may result in unexpected budget overruns, causing financial strain and potentially limiting the scope of your project. Conclusion Choosing the right Adobe Commerce Partner is pivotal for your eCommerce venture. i95Dev stands as a beacon of trust and expertise. Our track record as an Adobe Commerce Specialized Silver Solution Partner showcases our dedication to excellence. With end-to-end services, industry insight, faster go to market and budget flexibility and robust support, we’re your trusted ally in crafting success. Elevate your eCommerce journey with i95Dev and unlock the potential of your online store. Contact us today! Or Download the checklist to choose your right Adobe Commerce partner. chunks.title: URGENT Security Advisory: SessionReaper (CVE-2025-54236) – Adobe Commerce & Magento Open-Source

headings.text: URGENT Security Advisory: SessionReaper (CVE-2025-54236) – Adobe Commerce & Magento Open-Source

chunks.content: URGENT Security Advisory: SessionReaper (CVE-2025-54236) – Adobe Commerce & Magento Open-Source A newly discovered critical vulnerability, SessionReaper (CVE-2025-54236), impacts Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source. This flaw allows account takeover without user interaction through the Commerce REST API and has been rated 9.1/10 Critical on the National Vulnerability Database (NVD). Adobe has released a hotfix (VULN-32437-2-4-X-patch). Merchants must apply it immediately and verify patch status to avoid exposure. What happened Security researchers discovered an input-validation flaw in the Commerce REST API that lets an attacker forge or manipulate session-related input and gain access to customer accounts. Because the exploit requires no customer action, its impact is especially severe for merchants handling sensitive customer and payment data. Identifiers & references CVE: CVE-2025-54236 Nickname: SessionReaper NVD severity: 9.1 / 10 Adobe Security Bulletin: APSB25-88 Hotfix: VULN-32437-2-4-X-patch Who is affected Adobe Commerce – 2.4.9-alpha2 and earlier (includes 2.4.8-p2, 2.4.7-p7, 2.4.6-p12, 2.4.5-p14, 2.4.4-p15, and other patch versions). Adobe Commerce B2B — 1.5.3-alpha2 and earlier (and listed patch families). Magento Open Source — 2.4.9-alpha2 and earlier (and listed patch families). Custom Attributes Serializable module — versions 0.1.0 → 0.4.0. If your platform version or any of the listed modules match the ranges above, you are at risk. Immediate actions (one-page checklist) Apply Adobe’s hotfix: VULN-32437-2-4-X-patch — apply immediately to affected instances. Update module (if applicable) composers require Magento/out-of-process-custom-attributes=0.4.0 –with-dependencies Verify patch application using the Quality Patches Tool or your normal patch verification workflow. Check logs & user accounts: review authentication logs and unusual session activity (failed/successful logins, new admin/customer account creations, session anomalies). If on Adobe Commerce Cloud: confirm WAF rules are active (Adobe deployed WAF protections), but do not rely solely on the WAF, apply the hotfix anyway. If you’re on Managed Services: contact your Customer Success Engineer for guided remediation and validation. Rotate keys & credentials used by integrations that depend on user sessions or API authentication if you suspect compromise. Monitor for indicators of compromise and enable additional logging and alerting until the environment is confirmed clean. Need help applying the patch? Contact i95Dev’s Adobe Commerce security team for immediate support. Why Is This Urgent? The vulnerability enables account takeover without user interaction, meaning attackers don’t need a phishing click or social engineering to exploit it. A leaked hotfix (reported by researchers) increases the risk: attackers may reverse-engineer the patch to create exploits. Customer data, stored payment instruments, order history and account trust are at stake — any compromise has immediate reputational and regulatory risk. Verification & testing Run integration + smoke tests that exercise login, session creation, and API endpoints. Validate WAF rules (if present) and test that expected traffic patterns are still allowed, and malicious vectors are blocked. Reproduce known attack patterns in a safe staging environment only, do not test exploit techniques on production. Post-patch hardening recommendations Enforce stronger session management and shorter session lifetimes where possible. Add multi-factor authentication for admin and support access. Review third-party extensions for similar input-validation weaknesses. Schedule a follow-up security review and pen test after patching to ensure no lateral issues remain. Action plan template you can use immediately Run an inventory of Magento/Commerce versions & installed modules. Schedule hotfix deployment to staging → test → production (apply hotfix ASAP). Verify with Quality Patches Tool and run session/authentication test cases. Monitor logs for anomalies 24–72 hours after deployment. Communicate to customers if you detect any suspicious account activity (follow regulatory/incident response protocol if needed). Conclusion: If you want to secure your account, i95Dev is here to help. Our Adobe Commerce/ Magento and security specialists will: Assess your site’s exposure Apply and validate the hotfix Audit logs for suspicious activity Implement hardening and continuous monitoring Contact us today to get immediate assistance and protect your customers and your business.

chunks.title: OpenAI Launches ChatGPT App Store: What It Means for Developers & Users | i95dev

headings.text: OpenAI Launches ChatGPT App Store: What It Means for Developers & Users | i95dev

chunks.content: OpenAI Launches ChatGPT App Store: What It Means for Developers & Users | i95dev OpenAI Launches ChatGPT App Store: Ushering in a New Era of Conversational Commerce for eCommerce Leaders In a move poised to reshape digital interactions, OpenAI has officially launched the ChatGPT App Store, opening submissions for third-party developers and transforming the AI chatbot into a bustling hub for embedded applications. Announced just days ago on December 18, this platform—building on the October 2025 release of the Apps SDK—allows seamless integration of services like DoorDash, Apple Music, and Slack directly into ChatGPT conversations, eliminating the need for app downloads or website switches. For e-commerce businesses, this signals an urgent pivot to conversational commerce, where AI-driven dialogues could unlock frictionless chat-to-checkout experiences and tap into a weekly audience of over 800 million users. The launch comes at a pivotal moment for the $6.5 trillion global e-commerce market, already grappling with stagnant conversion rates and rising customer acquisition costs (CAC). As traditional funnels give way to intent-based interactions, e-commerce leaders are racing to embed their brands in this AI-native distribution ecosystem. What is the ChatGPT App Store? At its core, the ChatGPT App Store functions as an in-product directory accessible via web, iOS, and Android interfaces. Users discover and engage with apps, from productivity tools like Photoshop to delivery services, without leaving their chat thread. Powered by the new Apps SDK, which includes pre-built templates and UI libraries, developers can now launch conversational experiences in days, not months. This builds on OpenAI’s earlier GPT Store but expands to full-fledged “apps” that handle transactions, data syncing, and multi-turn dialogues. Early integrations highlight e-commerce potential: Imagine querying “best sustainable sneakers under $100” and instantly browsing options from Nike or Adidas, complete with size recommendations and one-click purchase, all within ChatGPT. Why eCommerce Must Embrace Conversational Commerce Now The implications for e-commerce are profound, particularly in B2B and DTC segments where purchase cycles often span multiple touchpoints. Here’s how the ChatGPT App Store disrupts the status quo: Instant Scale and Visibility : With 800 million weekly active users, the platform offers organic reach far surpassing social media ad auctions. E-commerce brands can surface products during high-intent moments, slashing CAC by up to 50% through zero-ad discovery. Streamlined Chat-to-Checkout Flows : Traditional e-commerce funnels—plagued by 70% cart abandonment—fade in favor of AI-orchestrated transactions. Users express needs (“bulk office supplies for 50 employees”), and apps deliver curated catalogs, pricing, and secure payments in real-time. From SEO to Intent-Driven Discovery : Search engine optimization (SEO) yields to conversational triggers. As McKinsey notes in its 2025 AI survey, agentic interfaces like these could add $2.6 trillion to $4.4 trillion in economic value by enhancing personalization and reducing friction in B2B procurement. Strategies for eCommerce Brands to Capitalize on the Launch Forward-thinking e-commerce leaders are already submitting apps to secure prime “shelf space” in the nascent directory, where competition remains low. Key tactics include: Leverage the Apps SDK for Quick Wins : Use OpenAI’s developer tools to prototype e-commerce bots—think personalized recommendation engines or inventory checkers—that integrate with existing platforms like WooCommerce or BigCommerce. Prioritize High-Intent Triggers : Design apps to activate on specific user prompts, such as “eco-friendly packaging suppliers” for B2B queries, embedding your catalog as the default response. Pilot Transactional Integrations : Test chat-to-checkout with partners like Stripe, focusing on mobile-first experiences to boost mobile commerce conversions, which now account for 60% of e-commerce traffic. Early adopters, including DoorDash and Booking.com, report 30% lifts in user engagement, underscoring the platform’s potential for conversational commerce ROI. Opportunities and Hurdles in the AI eCommerce Shift While the ChatGPT App Store promises a trillion-dollar AI ecosystem by 2030, it’s not without challenges. The directory’s rapid evolution means e-commerce teams must upskill in prompt engineering and AI ethics, while navigating OpenAI’s review process for submissions. Opportunities Challenges Organic discovery to 800M+ users, bypassing paid ads. Short window for early positioning—months, not years—before algorithmic rankings solidify. 15-20% revenue uplift from AI personalization in e-commerce. Infrastructure gaps, like maturing in-chat monetization for digital goods. Natural, context-aware interactions fostering loyalty in B2B e-commerce. Shift from click-based to conversational UIs demands team retraining. The Road Ahead for Conversational Commerce As 2025 draws to a close, the ChatGPT App Store stands as OpenAI’s boldest step toward an “everything app,” blending AI with everyday utilities to redefine e-commerce. For industry leaders, the launch is a clarion call: Integrate now to embed your brand in millions of daily dialogues, or cede ground to agile competitors. With projections signaling a $1 trillion AI market by 2031, the fusion of conversational commerce and e-commerce innovation isn’t optional—it’s the key to thriving in tomorrow’s digital marketplace.

chunks.title: Comprehensive Guide to eCommerce ERP Integration Technologies | i95Dev

headings.text: Comprehensive Guide to Various eCommerce ERP Integration Technologies

chunks.content:
A practical guide to understanding different eCommerce-ERP integration technologies, their benefits, challenges, and how to choose the right solution for your business.

In today’s fast-paced digital economy driven by multiple disconnected systems, seamless operations are critical. Integrating the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system with the eCommerce platform is essential for achieving operational efficiency and delivering superior customer experiences.

Why integrate eCommerce and ERP systems?

ERP systems are the backbone of modern enterprises, facilitating seamless data flow across departments and enhancing decision-making capabilities.

Integration leads to:

Data Consistency – Ensures all business units and channels operate on the same data.
Enhanced Efficiency – Reduces manual effort and streamlines processes.
Improved Customer Experience – Provides better inventory visibility and real-time order updates.
Informed Decision Making – Enables unified business insights for strategic planning.

chunks.title: Comprehensive Guide to eCommerce ERP Integration Technologies | i95Dev

headings.text: ETL and EDI Integration Technologies

chunks.content:
3.1 ETL (Extract, Transform, Load)

ETL is a widely used method for bulk data transfer between systems.

Extract – Pulls relevant data from source systems.
Transform – Converts data into required format.
Load – Writes processed data into target systems.

Pros:
Cost-effective
Quick implementation
Efficient bulk transfers

Cons:
No real-time updates
Limited customization
Data integrity risks
Business logic bypassed

Ideal Use Cases:
Bulk database transfers
Data warehousing
Analytics snapshots

3.2 Electronic Data Interchange (EDI)

EDI standardizes B2B transactional communication.

Pros:
Secure and standardized
Scalable
Low maintenance

Cons:
High implementation cost
Scheduled sync (not real-time)
Limited customization

Ideal Use Cases:
B2B vendor communication
Purchase orders and invoice exchange
Regulated industries

chunks.title: Comprehensive Guide to eCommerce ERP Integration Technologies | i95Dev

headings.text: APIs, Webhooks and ISV Add-ons

chunks.content:
Understanding APIs:
APIs enable real-time communication between applications and isolate integration logic from core systems.
They support flexible, scalable integrations.

Understanding Webhooks:
Webhooks push data via HTTP callbacks when specific events occur, eliminating the need for polling.

3.3 ISV Add-ons / ERP-driven Integrations

ISV Add-ons extend ERP systems to facilitate integration with eCommerce platforms.

Pros:
Targeted functionality
Data integrity through APIs
Vendor support
Ease of adoption

Cons:
Complex setup
Vendor dependency
Scalability challenges
Compatibility concerns

Ideal Use Cases:
Proprietary systems without strong APIs
Industry-specific customization needs

chunks.title: Comprehensive Guide to eCommerce ERP Integration Technologies | i95Dev

headings.text: Middleware and iPaaS Integration

chunks.content:
3.4 Middleware Integration Solutions

Middleware acts as a bridge between systems handling data routing and transformation.

Pros:
Interoperability
Scalability
Real-time support via APIs/Webhooks
Vendor-backed support

Cons:
Performance overhead
Complex management
Vendor reliance

Ideal Use Cases:
Modern API-based systems
Custom business workflows

3.5 Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS)

iPaaS is a cloud-based hub-and-spoke integration model with pre-built connectors.

Pros:
Centralized management
Rapid deployment
Scalable
Secure

Cons:
Limited customization
Vendor lock-in
Subscription costs
Potential latency

Ideal Use Cases:
Multi-system integration
Standardized integrations
Rapid prototyping

chunks.title: Comprehensive Guide to eCommerce ERP Integration Technologies | i95Dev

headings.text: Hybrid, Platform Connectors and Custom-built Solutions

chunks.content:
3.6 Hybrid Integration Platforms (HIP)

Combines on-premise and cloud integration models.
Ideal for businesses transitioning to cloud environments.

3.7 Pre-built / Platform-built Connectors

Vendor-provided connectors for common integrations.

Pros:
Rapid deployment
Low cost
Easy maintenance

Cons:
Limited flexibility
Vendor dependency
Multi-system limitations

3.8 Custom-built Solutions

Tailored integration frameworks designed for unique business needs.

Pros:
Full control
Highly customizable

Cons:
High cost
Maintenance complexity
Requires specialized expertise

chunks.title: Comprehensive Guide to eCommerce ERP Integration Technologies | i95Dev

headings.text: Key Considerations and Conclusion

chunks.content:
Key Considerations for Choosing Integration Technology:

Business Goals Alignment
Scalability
Technical Expertise
Security and Compliance
Cost and Budget
Vendor Support
Compatibility and Interoperability
Performance and Latency
Ease of Use
Flexibility and Customization
Future-Proofing

Conclusion:
ERP integration is a strategic decision impacting operational efficiency and customer experience.
Selecting the right integration approach requires balancing technology capabilities, business goals, and long-term scalability.
A holistic integration strategy ensures sustainable growth and digital transformation success.

chunks.title: Siegers Seeds – i95dev

headings.text: Siegers Seeds – i95dev

chunks.content: Success Story # With over a century of experience in the vegetable seed market, Siegers Seed continues to rule the legacy with i95Dev. Founded in 1912 in Chicago, Siegers Seed Company has over a century of experience in delivering unique and quality seeds to farmers across the USA. Recently taken over by Stokes, the company serves commercial growers in the Midwest, Northeastern, Mid-Atlantic, and Southeastern United States, as well as in Canada. With over 100 years of experience, a wide range of fresh vegetable seeds, and proven traditional trial programs, the leading brand guarantees to serve customers with dependable service and fulfill any vegetable seed need! Industry Agriculture (Vegetable Seeds) Headquarters Holland, Michigan, USA Products used i95Dev’s eCommerce Growth Engine (EGE), Microsoft Dynamics GP I am amazed by the power of the EGE solution – we are only few weeks into the solution but I am already confident that we have chosen the best possible platform to help us grow our business. – Joseph Soriano , IT Manager, Siegers Seed Company How We Made It Happen About the Company Founded in 1912 in Chicago, Siegers Seed Company has over 100 years of expertise in delivering high-quality vegetable seeds to commercial growers across the United States and Canada. Now a part of Stokes, the company continues its legacy of trust and excellence, serving diverse agricultural needs through robust trial programs and an extensive product portfolio. Goals & Challenges The goal was to have an end-to-end integrated eCommerce system. A system that is capable of handling the large portfolio of products Siegers Seed holds. Therefore, reducing the effort and cost associated with managing customers and operations manually (telephone and online ordering system). The second most important goal was to achieve effective warehouse management across all the four warehouses across the USA. Dynamics GP ERP system integrated with the e-store to manage all the back-office operations associated with inventory management and streamlined business processes. i95Dev conducted a thorough analysis of Siegers Seed’s day-to-day operations and associated challenges through a detailed discovery process and recommended its integrated eCommerce solution, EGE. An i95Dev solution that is capable of handling both B2C and B2B businesses. i95Dev implemented EGE that was capable of handling their customers across devices, provided layered navigation, excellent search capabilities, and powerful promotional tools. After the successful implementation, i95Dev conducted EGE’s integration with Dynamics GP seamlessly. This enabled them to better manage inventory by eliminating overselling of products through real-time inventory checks during order placement. The integration also automated the payment, shipping, and taxation method by integration. i95Dev continues to work with Siegers Seed Company to get their B2B customers on to the same platform, including the ability to create separate B2B-specific accounts to place orders directly on the site. 1200+ Projects Completed 450+ Customers across 15+ Countries 25+ Industries Served 150+ eCommerce Enthusiasts Let’s Connect Real Impact. Measurable Results. At i95Dev, we don’t just deliver solutions — we deliver measurable impact. Our success stories highlight how our innovative strategies have helped businesses overcome modern-day challenges, streamline operations, and achieve digital growth. Increased Efficiency Siegers Seed Company has seen an increase in order volume by more than 20%. Improved Scalability They were able to decrease their fulfillment time by 30% after the integration took place. Accelerated Order Processing Improved customer experience and process orders quickly by automating payments, taxation, and shipping. Enhanced Data Accuracy i95Dev’s EGE minimized their cost of customer acquisition, reduced the time and efforts spent by the sales representatives, therefore reducing the average sales cycle time. Real Results in Action See how our solution streamlined operations and delivered measurable impact for the client. Ready to Transform Your Business? chunks.title: Trail Gear | i95Dev

headings.text: Trail Gear | i95Dev

chunks.content: Success Story # Helping Trail Gear become the world’s largest manufacturer and distributor of off-road products Trail-Gear, Inc., founded in 2005, is a globally recognized leader in the design, manufacturing,and distribution of off-road products for hardcore rock crawlers, racers and trail enthusiasts. With a collection of over 2,000 products for Toyota, Suzuki, Nissan, and Jeep vehicles as well as builder parts and universal products, Trail Gear’s vision is to be the world’s first choice in the off-road market through dedication to superior quality, service and value. Industry Off-Road Automotive Parts & Accessories Headquarters Fresno, California, USA Products used Adobe Commerce (Magento), Microsoft Dynamics GP I do not say this lightly – I can honestly say that finding i95Dev and having the opportunity to work with them has been a blessing to Trail-Gear and to me, personally. We’ve to be a trusted partner in this endeavour. had some very positive feedback about the site from some very important customers. i95Dev has done a tremendous job providing support, instruction, effective and eloquent solutions, problem solving and communication. We still have a long way to go to achieve all of our goals, but i95Dev is proving themselves. – Eric Bako, Technical Head, Trail Gear. How We Made It Happen About the Company Trail-Gear is a leading manufacturer and distributor of off-road vehicle parts and accessories. Known for innovation and reliability, they also manage acquired brands like All-Pro Off-Road and Low Range Off-Road. Goals & Challenges Achieving stability to keep up with Trail-Gear’s fast growing pace along with an acquisition of All-Pro Off-Road and Low Range Off-Road brands, all while retaining the brands when consolidating all front and backend systems (eCommerce and ERP). Achieving Flexibility & Rigid Functionality for the eCommerce store to support Trail-Gear’s rapidly evolving requirements and business workflows related to back orders, fulfillment, payment terms, bill pay, promotions, and more. Achieving seamless integration since Trail-Gear’s existing integration with Dynamics GP was fraught with problems. Their existing integrated setup included data integrity issues between systems and duplicate and unsynchronized records. Trail-Gear customer support staff along with their I.T team were constantly spending unnecessary man-hours rectifying semi-automated systems. i95Dev engaged with the entire Trail-Gear team to discover the challenges with day-to-day operations along with the longer-term initiatives. This helped Trail-Gear immensely by enabling them to better understand their own requirements while also making them aware of the equally immense potential of Magento and integration. i95Dev, with its extensive experience in the Automotive OEM and Aftermarket industry has taken upon moving Trail-Gear from a proprietary eCommerce product to Magento Commerce for the Trail-Gear eCommerce expansion.Initially planning to develop the Magento 2 store in-house, Trail-Gear approached i95Dev to provide Magento GP integration. However, after their experience working with i95Dev during the discovery stage, Trail-Gear opted to work with i95Dev for the entire project – including Magento. To make things more manageable, the entire project was broken down into two phases. Magento Store Development & Migration – In Phase 1, Trail-Gear’s existing eCommerce store was designed, developed then migrated from their proprietary eCommerce cart to Magento 2. Included within the project, i95Dev team assisted Trail-Gear with an extensive data cleansing service to ensure optimum data across all systems. ERP Integration & Enhancements – In Phase 2, the i95Dev Magento GP Connect product was deployed to integrate their Magento eCommerce store with their Dynamics GP ERP system that included bi-directional sync of data. Further, the eCommerce store and integration were extended to automate business workflows and to incorporate their business specific requirements.as then tailored to meet their business specific needs like 1200+ Projects Completed 450+ Customers across 15+ Countries 25+ Industries Served 150+ eCommerce Enthusiasts Let’s Connect Real Impact. Measurable Results. At i95Dev, we don’t just deliver solutions — we deliver measurable impact. Our success stories highlight how our innovative strategies have helped businesses overcome modern-day challenges, streamline operations, and achieve digital growth. Increased Efficiency Trail-Gear is now relieved that they are on a more flexible platform and confident to move their other two brands, All-Pro Off-Road (on WordPress) and Low Range Off-Road (on Magento 1), to the same Magento 2 store leveraging Magento’s multi-store functionality. Increased Efficiency Customer service teams can now better serve B2B and international customers with incorporation of features like Customer Groups & Price Levels, Credit Limits, Net Terms, and Bill Pay. Improved Scalability Trail-Gear’s marketing team also leveraged Magento’s marketing & promotion capabilities to target and drive promotional campaigns – something they desperately needed. Enhanced Data Accuracy Leveraging advanced functionality like backorder support, drop ship, partial shipment and invoice, tax management, and more, the fulfillment team can now streamline and automate their order fulfillment process. Accelerated Order Processing Both customers and sales reps now have access to a fast and more effective system to place orders, enabling sales reps to better serve their customers. Real Results in Action See how our solution streamlined operations and delivered measurable impact for the client. Ready to Transform Your Business? headings.text: Effortless Shopping – your secret to driving sales and customer experiences – i95dev

chunks.content: Effortless Shopping – your secret to driving sales and customer experiences – i95dev Use Case# Effortless Shopping – your secret to driving sales and customer experiences i95Dev can help you simplify and drive intuitive customer shopping experiences through improved product discovery by leveraging complex product relationships. Drive Shopping Experience Effortless shopping drives sales and customer experience Effortless shopping delivers a smooth, intuitive experience, helping customers find and buy products with ease. By reducing friction and simplifying the journey, businesses boost satisfaction, loyalty, and sales. Experience Drives Value 67% of consumers and 74% of business buyers say they’ll pay more for a great experience. Power of Experience In a recent PwC study, about two-thirds (65%) of respondents in the US feel that a positive experience with a brand is more influential than great advertising. Effortless Wins: Transforming the B2B Buying Journey The number one factor in delivering a great customer experience is not delighting customers but reducing their efforts. However, the product discovery and buying process in the B2B world is usually very complex. This often leads to: Improve Product Discovery The improved product catalog enabled customers to discover new products easily and quickly, reducing the on-field sales effort. Drive Sales The product relationship information helped in identifying cross-selling opportunities and thereby driving sales. Build Efficient Operations The eCommerce ERP integration enabled the merchant to manage all product information from one system. How i95Dev Leveraged Product Relationships To Help a Leading Auto Manufacturer? Overcoming B2B Commerce Challenges in the Auto Aftermarket Industry Operating in a fragmented and mostly offline automobile aftermarket industry, this leading auto parts manufacturer struggled to drive B2B commerce adoption because of the nature of the products and the complex relationship between them. Unstructured product catalogs, complex navigation, and poor search was slowing them down, affecting sales, customer adoption, and customer experience. Unlocking ERP Insights to Power an Advanced Product E-Catalog i95Dev experts conducted an in-depth discovery and worked with the manufacturer to understand the business challenges, data in existing systems, and current business processes. We discovered the goldmine of information that the manufacturer had as product relationships in the ERP system and leveraged that to build an advanced and interactive product e-catalog. This helped the auto manufacturer: For most businesses, their inventory is spread across multiple locations – warehouses, distribution centers, retail locations, and others. Inventory availability across multiple locations can be the secret ingredient that gives businesses an edge in implementing affordable and efficient shipping solutions. Improve Product Discovery The improved product catalog enabled customers to discover new products easily and quickly, reducing the on-field sales effort. Drive Sales The product relationship information helped in identifying cross-selling opportunities and thereby driving sales. Build Efficient Operations The eCommerce ERP integration enabled the merchant to manage all product information from one system. Enhance Product Search The interactive and information-rich product images enabled customers to find the right product easily and quickly. Increase Product Understanding A bird’s-eye view of the products and related components gave customers a better understanding of the products. Improve eCommerce Adoption The ease of browsing and shopping online enabled the manufacturer to onboard B2B customers effortlessly. In addition, the eCommerce store served as a self-service customer/ dealer portal. Are you also looking to drive digital transformation and customer experience through the innovative use of eCommerce and integration? You are in great hands with i95Dev. Unlocking ERP Insights to Power an Advanced Product E-Catalog i95Dev experts conducted an in-depth discovery and worked with the manufacturer to understand the business challenges, data in existing systems, and current business processes. We discovered the goldmine of information that the manufacturer had as product relationships in the ERP system and leveraged that to build an advanced and interactive product e-catalog.

chunks.title: Transform Procurement with ERP-Integrated Purchase Order Systems

headings.text: Transform Procurement with ERP-Integrated Purchase Order Systems

chunks.content: Transform Procurement with ERP-Integrated Purchase Order Systems Use Case# Improve Operational Efficiency and Vendor Relationships with ERP Integrated Purchase Order Management System Whether you are a small brand or a large organization, an efficient and streamlined purchase order process is crucial for successful business operations. Continue reading to find out how an eCommerce brand worked with i95Dev to develop an ERP-integrated purchase order management solution to track, manage, and optimize purchase orders — keeping their business in control and operations efficient. Read more What is Purchase Order Management? Purchase Order Management is the process of creating, tracking, and managing purchase orders from initial request to delivery. It involves coordinating with suppliers, managing order status, tracking inventory levels, and keeping financial records updated. Many organizations have processes defined to ensure standardized procurement. However, use of spreadsheets and emails as tools for communication and record keeping works only for smaller operations. For growing and larger organizations, these can create confusion and cause delays. For eCommerce businesses, effective purchase order management is crucial for maintaining the right stock levels, minimizing order delays, and ensuring a seamless supply chain. With the growing complexity of inventory needs and supplier relationships, a streamlined purchase order management system automates manual tasks, reduces errors, and enhances control over the order process, resulting in better accuracy, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction. Key Benefits of Using a Purchase Order Management System Implementing a Purchase Order Management System can transform how you manage inventory,suppliers, and operations. Here are the top benefits: Enhanced Order Accuracy Automating purchase orders helps reduce manual data entry errors, ensuring your order information is accurate and consistent. This leads to fewer mistakes, improved supplier relationships, and reduced returns or disputes. Real-Time Order Tracking Gain visibility into each order’s status from placement to delivery. Real-time updates allow your team to monitor progress, anticipate potential delays, and communicate proactively with customers and suppliers. Improved Supplier Management Centralize all supplier information, including pricing, terms, and performance history. This helps streamline communication, allows for better negotiation on terms, and fosters stronger, more reliable supplier partnerships. Cost and Inventory Control By optimizing when and how you place orders, you avoid unnecessary stock levels and reduce carrying costs. A good Purchase Order Management System helps you stay lean on inventory while meeting customer demand, preventing stockouts and overstocking. Data-Driven Decision-Making Access insights and analytics on purchasing trends, supplier performance, and inventory turnover. With this data, you can make informed decisions on reordering, budget allocations, and sourcing strategies, ensuring your operations align with business goals. Compliance and Financial Record Accuracy Track every purchase order and create a comprehensive audit trail to maintain compliance with financial regulations and company policies. This ensures accurate financial reporting and reduces the risk of discrepancies in bookkeeping. Want to Automate your Integration? A Purchase Order Management System is more than just a tool; it’s a strategy for better inventory, supplier, and financial control, setting up your business for long-term success in a competitive eCommerce landscape. Talk to our team for more information. Talk to an i95Dev Expert Success Story: Leading Sports Brand Streamlines Purchase Orders with Vendor Portal About the Client A dynamic multi-brand organization from the sporting goods and recreation industry struggled to manage purchase orders across suppliers. They relied heavily on spreadsheets and emails as tools for record keeping and communications. This created significant challenges like increased manual efforts, data entry errors, poor visibility into PO status, inefficient operations, and scalability constraints as the business grew and they acquired more brands. Solution Recognizing client’s needs, i95Dev implemented a comprehensive vendor portal with purchase order management capabilities. The portal’s role-based access controls and self-services capabilities enabled suppliers to view and manage their own purchase orders. The portal was also integrated with client’s Microsoft ERP system, enabling seamless data synchronization across all platforms (eCommerce, ERP, and Vendor Portal). Result The Vendor Portal transformed client’s purchase order management operations. The automation eliminated manual errors, improved cost and inventory control, enabled real-time order tracking, increased operational efficiency, and strengthened supplier relationship. Streamline Your Purchase Order Management Whether you’re scaling your business or managing complex supplier networks, we can help you achieve seamless purchase order management. chunks.title: B2B Customer Self Service Portal for eCommerce Platform | i95Dev

headings.text: B2B Customer Self Service Portal for eCommerce Platform | i95Dev

chunks.content: B2B Customer Self Service Portal for eCommerce Platform | i95Dev Use Case# B2B Customers Self-Service Portal The B2B Customers Self-Service Portal is a secure, user-friendly platform that allows business clients to manage their accounts, place and track orders, view invoices, and access support—anytime, anywhere. It streamlines operations, reduces response times, and empowers customers with greater control over their interactions. Designed to improve efficiency and enhance customer satisfaction. Tell me More Challenges B2B businesses face while managing B2B buyers online B2B brands are slowly moving towards eCommerce, which needs improvement. Though the businesses are transitioning to an online method, the way B2B merchants conduct business has changed, and so has the B2B buyer behaviour and expectations. Sales Friction A poor online B2B portal with maximum dependency on the sales reps to complete a purchase, negatively impacts the buyer. Delayed Conversion The waiting time to connect to a sales representative encourages B2B buyers to consider other buying options. Inefficient Procurement The traditional rounds of quotations and approvals are not so productive and are time-consuming. Feature Mismatch eCommerce platforms fail to offer B2B-specific features as they are built to be B2C-centric originally. Digital Shift The pandemic effects are here to stay, and not many B2B buyers are willing to purchase in person. Pricing Ambiguity B2B buyers find it challenging to get the final price payable due to complex pricing structure. A Berkshire Hathaway Company has been the world’s most trusted uniform manufacturer for public safety since 1842. Based in Cincinnati, Ohio, the B2B & B2C company deals with standardized men’s uniforms, developed for the first time in American history for more than 175 years. Fechheimer had an online store. However, it was only equipped to showcase the huge product catalog it inherited for years. They lacked a full-fledged eCommerce store for doing business and, most importantly, a B2B self-service-oriented portal. Collaborating with i95Dev i95Dev’s B2B and eCommerce experts conducted a step-by-step discovery session and found many loopholes resisting their growth. The project was completed in 3 phases where i95Dev suggested: Smart Orders i95Dev developed smart eCommerce features like order edits, backorder cancellations that allowed customers to edit orders after they placed, cancel the complete or partial order, etc. Dynamic Pricing Fechheimer had a complex pricing model that confused B2B buyers. i95Dev customized Magento to auto-calculate and display the final price based on customer-specific factors like loyalty, order quantity, and shipping address. ERP Upgrade Due to Dynamics AX ERP’s limited usage and outdated features, i95Dev recommended switching to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations. This ensured better compatibility and performance for Fechheimer’s new Magento stores. ERP Integration Secondly, i95Dev integrated Dynamics AX ERP with the newly developed Magento stores. Store Development B2B and B2C Magento eStore development, where top eCommerce functionalities were implemented Advantages of collaborating with us Partnering with us means access to expert support, cutting-edge tools, and streamlined multi-channel solutions. We help you save time, reduce hassle, and grow your sales efficiently across all major platforms. Autonomous Purchasing Fechheimer’s B2B customers are happy with the new self-service B2B buying portal, which needs close to zero human intervention. Digital Reinvention Magento B2B and B2C stores gave the brand a new face in the highly digitalized world. Automated Efficiency The ERP integration and upgrade lead to increased productivity by automation. Customer Magnet Fechheimer is topping the game of customer satisfaction and successfully attracting more customers than ever before. Are you too finding it challenging to provide B2B customers an efficient self-service buying portal? If yes, reach out to us today. No need to lose your sleep over it.
