chunks.title: Pharma companies impacted by COVID-19: i95Dev comes to the rescue

headings.text: Pharma companies impacted by COVID-19: i95Dev comes to the rescue

chunks.content: Pharma companies impacted by COVID-19: i95Dev comes to the rescue Pharma companies impacted by COVID-19:i95Dev comes to the rescue Author Category Share COVID-19 has shaken the world to the core. The coronavirus pandemic hasn’t spared any industry. Most of the companies are redesigning and redefining their businesses while others with more stability are fighting tooth and claw. At a time when large businesses are incurring huge losses and SMBs are heading for the hills, many of the online pharma companies are witnessing a significant jump in sales riding on the back of panic buying and stocking up. According to a recent survey , the pharmaceutical brick and mortar stores are facing commotions while pharma eCommerce is expecting a long-term benefit but at the cost of temporary losses. These losses are a result of changed consumer behaviour and disrupted supply chain. Pharma companies impacted by COVID-19: AstraZeneca (AZ) has witnessed a revenue downturn as most of its business generates in China where the COVID-19 outbroke. To make things worse, coronavirus has severely impacted economies of the US and Europe from where AstraZeneca fostered another major chunk of its sales. However, ecommerce has saved the day for AZ to some extent but not in a notable manner. AZ is making an attempt to come up with a vaccine for the virus by collaborating with Sanofi. Along with its ecommerce sales, this project might help the company recover its loss. Novartis, on the other hand, has made a killing out of forward buying as a result of the coronavirus outbreak. The company has nurtured sales worth 400 million dollars in its first quarter. According to the company, much of the impact did not come from wholesaler stockpiling but it came from ecommerce, longer prescriptions, and filling of prescriptions early by patients. Merck & Co. is expecting a 2.1 billion dollars dip in 2020 sales due to the coronavirus pandemic. The primary reason behind the fall is sales is reduced office visits by doctors. Albeit, the sales of Keytruda (a drug that sells like a hotcake) continued to run strong in the first quarter, Merck is anticipating a massive drop in sales in the second quarter. The company received some relief from its online sales where customers have been stocking up on products like animal healthcare medicines. Pfizer recorded an increase in revenue on the grounds of jump in ecommerce sales of its pneumonia vaccine (Prevnar 13). The serious cases of COVID-19 causes pneumonia with high death rates. Prevnar 13 comes handy in such cases. The company is expecting a further rise in revenue based on creating a vaccine for the pandemic by collaborating with BioNTech. In the first quarter, Johnson & Johnson’s sales in the medical device unit dipped by around 8 percent. Its pharma unit saw a surge of over 8 percent driven by ecommerce sales of cancer drugs. In addition, the company’s consumer health unit witnessed its sales jump by 9 percent due to demand for products in pain drugs as a result of panic buying. Many of the offline pharma companies having physical stores only suffered severe losses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. Realising the urgency to go digital, most of these companies are now expanding their customer reach by shifting online. However, ecommerce too has its shortcomings like supply chain disruptions, increase in overall demand, shortage of drugs, delayed deliveries, cancelled orders, product safety concerns, price gouging, cybersecurity threats, development-related challenges, requirement for increased bandwidth, false practices, and more. How to overcome these challenges? i95Dev comes to your rescue! For the offline pharma companies – i95Dev offers: Magento Solution packages – We will build an ecommerce store for you from scratch within 8 weeks. https://www.i95dev.com/magento-packages/ For the online pharma companies – i95Dev offers: EGE solution – This is our unique solution not possessed by anyone in the industry. It helps retailers, manufacturers, and distributors grow their online sales rapidly. The solution attracts, converts, and retains B2B and B2C customers and also integrates with your ERP system for streamlined order fulfilment. https://www.i95dev.com/integrated-ecommerce/ecommerce-for-microsoft-dynamics/ Integrating existing locations – We can integrate the B2B pharma online stores with the local brands and regional players, thereby, eliminating the problems of delayed and cancelled deliveries. In the same manner, the online pharma retailers can use this solution to expand their supply base by reaching out to multiple pharma manufacturers. Magento 2 extensions – If your pharma eCommerce store is on Magento, we can set up a multi-store website with the help of Magento 2 extensions. In this pandemic situation, you can use your multi-store to sell essential items that are in demand and upkeep the profit of your online business. Mobile App Integration and development – To meet the changing customer behaviour and to target them across channels in this pandemic situation, i95Dev can integrate the mobile applications of pharma companies with their Magento eCommerce store. It will help companies increase their sales by manifolds. POS Audit & Optimizations – The demand of medicines and drugs have shot up due to panic buying and stocking up. To deal with the rising demand pharma companies have to manage the inventory better. i95Dev optimizes and enhances the integration between Magento eCommerce store and RMS POS system and helps you manage the inventory seamlessly. chunks.title: Adobe Commerce 2.4.4: moving above and beyond Magento | i95Dev

headings.text: Adobe Commerce 2.4.4: moving above and beyond Magento | i95Dev

chunks.content: Adobe Commerce 2.4.4: moving above and beyond Magento | i95Dev Adobe Commerce 2.4.4: moving above and beyond magento Author Category Share So Magento got another update this month, but it’s more than a regular update- it’s a brand overhaul with some decent updates to the eCommerce platform’s underpinnings. Adobe purchased the Magento Ecommerce Edition in May 2018, and it recently rebranded it as Adobe Commerce, a move that impacts over 189,062 websites. ( Image Credits ) The experts at i95Dev have curated this blog to help our readers understand the dynamics behind this rebranding exercise. Let’s get started: Adobe Commerce Cloud 2.4.4 Addresses Multiple Security Concerns The new release includes patches for three security improvements and bug fixes each apart from security enhancements across the platform through a core codebase upgrade. Also, it includes security benefits like: As a result of security improvisation, session IDs will no longer be stored in the database. Non-alpha-numeric file extensions uploading will also become more secure as validation is fortified. The coupon codes, too, will get additional support from reCAPTCHA. Swagger will be disabled by default. Access and password reset tokens will also get encrypted when stored in the database. Also, these security patches are backported to Adobe Commerce 2.4.3-p2 and Adobe Commerce 2.3.7-p3 versions. Performance And Scalability Enhancements Order validation and cart operations have been optimized for enabling smoother checkout and fulfillment. Also, you will be able to process the orders at a quicker pace, making the overall user experience better for both you and your customers. AsyncOrder feature will allow you to process orders in the background while your customers are finishing their checkout. You can now enable inventory check for products added to carts. You can now allow multiple customers to perform various processes in parallel by adding multiple_processes configuration to your app/etc/env.php file for better task execution speed. With hundreds of variable products, carts can now be processed quickly with memory limit expansions. PayPal Enhancements Merchants will now benefit from the built-in Venmo payment inside Paypal. Based on geotargeting, customers can now choose to “Pay Later.” The customers will be explicitly notified regarding the charges associated with the “Pay Later” option on the checkout page. ( Image Credits ) Accessibility Updates Screen reader support is updated for all relevant Product Page elements. Readability is enhanced for low vision users through measures like improved contrast and icon relocation. It will become easier to navigate on the Cart and Checkout pages. The magnifying glass (used for searching products) will get a text-based alternative and an accessible name. Cart Enhancements The “Advertised Minimum Price” link is fixed and now clickable. It redirects the user towards an information popup. Earlier, Adobe Commerce displayed a ‘Payment Error’ message after a ‘Payment Error’ message which is now eliminated. If the increased shopping cart product quantity is deemed invalid, the value will be restored to the previous figure to maintain checkout page performance. Platform Enhancements Composer dependencies, including JS libraries like RequireJS, are upgraded to bring the platform to par with PHP 8.1 On top of that, support has been provided for TinyMCE 5, and PHPUnit is upgraded to 9.5.x Page Builder Enhancements Text editor issues faced while working on banner content are optimized along with table fonts. Popup windows like ‘Insert/Edit image’ and ‘Insert/Edit Link’ are now positioned better. The page builder is expected to receive more frequent updates in the future as it is one of the focus areas of Adobe at the moment. Additional Enhancements You can now successfully add Product Videos through the path Admin Catalog > Products > Add Video. Also, the save button will be enabled when an incomplete URL is added, while the additional fields will get auto-filled. The timestamps will now be converted into the user’s time zone in the export filename. Previously, this wasn’t possible, and Adobe only displayed the UTC timestamp. Adobe Commerce will not generate duplicate images in its remote storage upon importing CSV files multiple times. Why You Must Upgrade To Adobe Commerce 2.4.4 ASAP Despite being around for more than two decades, eCommerce is rapidly evolving while customer behavior is now augmented at a much higher rate. Using the latest version of Adobe Ecommerce will help you on multiple fronts, including the support for PHP 8.1, while you will also benefit from: Better integration with Adobe Experience Cloud applications. Better tools for your Adobe Ecommerce developers. Improved ability to customize your Adobe eCommerce store along with enhanced flexibility. Maintenance also becomes quicker and more affordable than the old (Magento) versions. Summing Up It is noteworthy that despite the rebranding, Magento Open Source, i.e., Magento Community Edition, will continue to exist as earlier. The updates in the latest version make a strong case for users to upgrade as they also help solve some of the persistent problems faced in the earlier versions. If you are facing any troubles upgrading from older Magento versions to Adobe Commerce 2.4.4, feel free to reach out to us anytime. Feel Free to get in touch with i95Dev today! chunks.content: Aquiform Success Story | Revolutionizing Pool Retail with i95Dev Success Story # Aquiform Streamlines Customer Journey and Business Operations with i95Dev Aquiform is a leading Canadian distributor in the pool, spa, and patio furniture industry. With over 60 years of experience, they manage an extensive 500,000 sq. ft.+ of storage network across Canada and a vast catalog of over 200,000 products. They provide personalized support to retailers, contractors, and service providers, with a strong focus on efficient deliveries and customer satisfaction. Industry Wholesale Distribution (Pool, Spa & Patio Products) Headquarters Burlington, Ontario, Canada Products used i95Dev eCommerce–ERP Integration Your team have done an amazing job by delivering these customizations within such a short timeframe. I want to express my gratitude to the team for their commitment to the project and the hard work you all have put in. I cannot thank you enough. – Robert Romano, Director of Sales & Marketing, Broadcast Supply Worldwide How We Made It Happen About the Company Aquiform is a premier Canadian distributor in the pool, spa, and patio furniture industry. With over 60 years of experience, a storage network exceeding 500,000 sq. ft., and a catalog of 200,000+ products, Aquiform serves retailers, contractors, and service providers with a strong commitment to fast delivery and personalized customer service. Goals & Challenges As Aquiform’s business continued to grow, they were finding it difficult to run an efficient operation. They were spending a lot of time and money in manual data entry between eCommerce and ERP systems. It was becoming difficult to manage their online presence. The multi-site setup aggravated the issues for them. The operational inefficiencies were starting to impact their customer experience. For Aquiform, the need to automate data sync between eCommerce and ERP was apparent. eCommerce ERP Integration: We automated customer, product, order, inventory, and more data sync between their eCommerce and ERP systems. However, for an effective setup they required additional capability on the eCommerce store to serve its customers better. Extending eCommerce & Integration Functionality: We identified and developed additional components to meet their business requirements. These additional components extended the capabilities of the eCommerce store and the i95Dev Connector, driving Aquiform operational efficiency and improving customer experience. Key Features: The key features/ functionality includes streamline B2B customer management, support personalized pricing and multiple Units of Measurements – in eCommerce and seamless information sync of the same with ERP system, support multi-source inventory, and more. In the process, we worked with Aquiform to streamline their entire customer journey (from Customer and Product to Order and Taxes) and their business processes. 1200+ Projects Completed 450+ Customers across 15+ Countries 25+ Industries served 150+ eCommerce Enthusiasts Let’s Connect Real Impact. Measurable Results. At i95Dev, we don’t just deliver solutions — we deliver measurable impact. Our success stories highlight how our innovative strategies have helped businesses overcome modern-day challenges, streamline operations, and achieve digital growth. Enhanced Operational Efficiency Automated data sync between ERP and eCommerce reducing manual data entry efforts and minimized errors. This resulted in streamlined & efficient operations, saving nearly $100,000 in manual data sync. Streamlined Business Integration automation helped Aquiform to streamline their business and adopt well-defined processes for managing their online presence. They are now able to manage a much larger order volume with fewer customer service resources. Smooth Customer Experience Customers are benefiting from availability of accurate product information, personalized pricing, and seamless order processing. This led to increased customer satisfaction and loyalty. Growth Ready Automation laid the groundwork for future scalability. The integrated ecosystem can effortlessly scale and accommodate increasing product portfolio and demand, while enabling data-backed decision making. Ready to Transform Your Business? chunks.content: Ohio Power Tool Success Story | Transforming eCommerce with i95Dev Success Story # Elevating eCommerce Excellence: Ohio Power Tools’ eCommerce Transformation Operating since 1983, Ohio Power Tools offers a comprehensive range of tools, supplies, repair services, equipment rentals and professional training to contractors and businesses all over the country. They have partnerships with over 120 manufacturers and is a factory-authorized service center for most air, electric, and hydraulic equipment brands. Industry Tools & Equipment Distribution Headquarters Columbus, Ohio, United States Products used Adobe Commerce Cloud, NetSuite How We Made It Happen About the Company Established in 1983, Ohio Power Tools is a trusted distributor of professional tools, equipment rentals, repair services, and training solutions for contractors and businesses nationwide. With partnerships across 120+ manufacturers and factory-authorized repair capabilities, they serve as a one-stop shop for air, electric, and hydraulic equipment. Goals & Challenges Ohio Power Tools had upgraded their eCommerce store from a custom estore to Adobe Commerce Cloud. The client faced several challenges working with a local vendor for their Adobe Commerce implementation. Their eCommerce store had major security and performance issues, which lead to a significant impact on revenue. Ohio Power Tool was contemplating moving away to a different eCommerce platform. However, at i95Dev, we were confident about the Adobe Commerce platform. We offered to work on revamping their Adobe eCommerce store and overcoming the existing challenges Store Performance: Ohio Power Tools’ eCommerce existing site was slow, the order process was too cumbersome requiring multiple clicks, and site navigation filled with errors. We conducted a thorough audit to uncover reasons for poor performance and started optimizing their online store. We implemented several enhancements like removing unnecessary extensions, reducing the size of JS and CSS files, upgrading Adobe Commerce, enabling cache, and more.siness specific needs like Enhancements and Upgrades: Enhance site usability and speed by introducing Adobe Commerce AMP pages. Configured one-step checkout process to reduce shopping cart abandonment. Help customer transition from GA3 to GA4 for improved analytics and reporting. Streamline integration with Google Merchant Center for improved visibility. Integrate Adobe Commerce store with NetSuite ERP to streamline order flow and centralize customer, product, and inventory information. Develop and enable advance functionality like Build your Packout tool and Dynamic personalized promotional banners. i95Dev’s solutions and services not only resolved Ohio Power Tools’ eStore issues, but also elevated their eCommerce capabilities, resulting in a more efficient and engaging online shopping experiences for their customers. 1200+ Projects Completed 450+ Customers across 15+ Countries 25+ Industries served 150+ eCommerce Enthusiasts Let’s Connect Real Impact. Improved Customer Satisfaction By providing accurate information, faster response times, and seamless experiences, businesses can exceed customer expectations. This strengthens trust and drives long-term loyalty. Increased Customer Base A stronger digital presence and streamlined operations enable businesses to attract and serve more customers. Expanding into new markets becomes easier with scalable solutions. Better Utilization of Existing Investment Maximize ROI by leveraging and extending the capabilities of current systems. Integrations ensure existing technology investments deliver greater value without costly replacements. i95Dev is fantastic at accommodating and addressing urgent issues. They recommended more than what the client wants—they offered better solutions. Unlike other agencies, they don’t just agree with you and do what you say, and that’s a good thing. chunks.title: Enhancing B2B Shopping: Streamlining Dealer Experience for Contractor Nation

headings.text: Enhancing B2B Shopping: Streamlining Dealer Experience for Contractor Nation

chunks.content: Enhancing B2B Shopping: Streamlining Dealer Experience for Contractor Nation Success Story # Contractor Nation: Streamlining B2B Customer Journey with Adobe Commerce Dynamics GP Integration Established in 1990, Contractor Nation is a network of home improvement, repair, and service contractors. Contractor Nation has 8 subsidiaries under the parent company such as Basement Systems, CleanSpace, Klaus Roofing Systems, and others. They partnered with i95Dev to elevate the B2B customer shopping experience across brands by leveraging eCommerce-ERP integration. Industry Home Improvement Contractors Headquarters Seymour, Connecticut, USA Products used Adobe Commerce (Magento), Microsoft Dynamics GP, SalesPad How We Made It Happen About the Company Contractor Nation is a premier network of home improvement and foundation repair contractors serving customers across North America. The company is dedicated to supporting its dealers with top-quality products, comprehensive training, and robust business tools to help them succeed. By centralizing operations and resources, Contractor Nation empowers contractors to deliver exceptional service and drive long-term growth. Their continued investment in innovation and technology reflects their commitment to enhancing both customer experience and operational efficiency. Goals & Challenges Poor Dealer Shopping Experience: Contractor Nation was looking for ways to streamline and enhance the B2B shopping experience without adding to the operational overheads. Operational Inefficiencies: Manual creation of orders and information sync between eCommerce and ERP systems was time consuming and error prone, leading to a lot of operational inefficiencies. Broken Shopping Experience: Despite adopting an eCommerce store, the shopping experience seemed disconnected and broken. Custom business workflows and multi-company structure further complicated things for Contractor Nation. While the solution involved multiple components, automating Adobe Commerce – Dynamics ERP integration was at the heart of it. Product & Inventory Management: We streamlined product and inventory management by automating eCommerce – ERP integration. With integration and by incorporating other business requirements we were able to personalize product visibility and pricing for logged in customers across multiple websites, streamline information sync between eCommerce, ERP, and SalesPad. Customer Management: i95Dev worked with Contractor Nation to manage dealers online effectively by incorporating customer approval process to sync approved customers from ERP to eCommerce store while onboarding existing customers seamlessly (even for customers with missing email and other relevant information), managing customer data and workflow across multiple companies, Order Fulfillment: The order fulfilment was also automated and streamlined by incorporating the following features Contractor Nation leveraged SalesPad to implement a custom order fulfillment workflow where they processed orders in batches, handled backorders, and more. The integration helped automate information sync from Magento eCommerce store to ERP/ SalesPad seamlessly. Sync orders to different companies based on order origin. Incorporating business specific requirements for shipping, payments, and more. 1200+ Projects Completed 450+ Customers across 15+ Countries 25+ Industries served 150+ eCommerce Enthusiasts Let’s Connect Real Impact. Measurable Results. At i95Dev, we don’t just deliver solutions — we deliver measurable impact. Our success stories highlight how our innovative strategies have helped businesses overcome modern-day challenges, streamline operations, and achieve digital growth. Improved Efficiency The integration solution facilitated real-time synchronization of critical data between the eCommerce platform and the ERP system, reducing manual efforts and improving overall operational efficiency. Enhanced Customer Experience With synchronized data, Contractor Nation could provide a more seamless and personalized experience for their B2B customers, leading to increased satisfaction and loyalty. Scalability and Flexibility The implemented solution brought scalability and flexibility, allowing Contractor Nation to adapt to changing business trends and meet the demands of a growing customer base. Successful Phased Implementation By achieving the high-level synchronization objectives in different phases, the project was considered successfully implemented, meeting the identified success criteria. Our company was looking for an e-commerce site for our dealers that tied directly to our ERP system. We needed a robust front end along with a flexible connector to our ERP system. Our project manager looked for someone with Great Plains/Sales Pad experience and suggested i95Dev. New to i95Dev, we wanted the best and that is exactly what we got. i95Dev was incredibly responsive and gave us options for what we wanted and was very accommodating. The project that no one in our organization thought would come to fruition, was finally launched earlier this year. We met on a weekly basis and the communication with i95Dev was exceptional. Everything was documented for us. The entire team at i95Dev was professional and were such a key component in making our online store a reality. – Lou Bemer , Director of Technology, Contractor Nation Ready to Transform Your Business? headings.text: Driving Operational Efficiency through eCommerce & ERP Integration

chunks.content: Driving Operational Efficiency through eCommerce & ERP Integration Success Story # Mossberg: Driving Operational Efficiency through eCommerce and ERP Integration Founded in 1919, O.F. Mossberg & Sons, Inc. is considered one of the most innovative firearms manufacturers in the U.S. history. They are globally recognized as the largest pump-action shotgun manufacturer, they have a portfolio of over 100 designs and utility patents and is credited as the first ISO 9001 certified long-gun manufacturer. They achieved operational excellence by automating eCommerce and ERP integration. Continue reading to know more. Industry Firearms Manufacturing Headquarters North Haven, Connecticut, USA Products used Adobe Commerce (Magento), Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, i95Dev AX Connect How We Made It Happen About the Company Mossberg & Sons is a leading American firearms manufacturer with a rich legacy dating back to 1919. Known for their high-quality shotguns, rifles, and firearm accessories, they serve diverse markets including civilian, law enforcement, and military sectors. Mossberg has built a reputation for innovation, precision, and reliability, making them one of the most trusted names in the industry. Their dedication to product excellence extends to their digital initiatives, as they continue to modernize operations and enhance customer experience through technology. Goals & Challenges To enhance customer’s shopping experience, Mossberg invested in an Adobe Commerce/ Magento eCommerce store. Keeping in mind the critical nature of their products and the industry, they aimed reduce order related to errors and enhance operational efficiency by automating data sync between Adobe Commerce/ Magento and Dynamics ERP systems. After meticulous vetting of several vendors, Mossberg and their eCommerce partner shortlisted i95Dev as their integration partner. Journey with i95Dev: Long-term Integration Partners What started as a project to integrate Magento and Microsoft Dynamics ERP systems translated into a long-term partnership for more than six years. Over these years, i95Dev worked with Mossberg to keep the integration updated as they upgraded their eCommerce and ERP systems and customized the integration to meet their business goals and requirements. In 2015-2016, we provided integration with i95Dev AX Connect and customized the solution per their specific operational needs. In 2022, Mossberg sought to upgrade their eCommerce and ERP system from Dynamics AX to Dynamics 365 F&O, again trusting i95Dev as their technology partner. Impressed with our expertise and commitment, Mossberg decided to extend the partnership with i95Dev by adding ERP enhancement, maintenance, and support activities. Key Features & Enhancements Manage Product & Inventory Information Effectively – i95Dev Connect centralized product, inventory, and pricing information in the ERP system, streamlining product information management and driving personalization, brand consistency, and trust. Improved Control – By extending the capabilities of the ERP system and integration, i95Dev enabled Mossberg to control and sync selected products from the ERP system to the online store better. Streamline and Automate Order Processing – i95Dev automated the order sync between the eCommerce and the ERP systems, eliminating manual order entry errors, enabling faster order processing, and improving customer satisfaction. Enhanced Customer Management – i95Dev Connect helped improve customer relationships by integrating customer data from multiple sources in a single repository, eliminating data silos, and offering a 360-degree view of their customers. And more. 1200+ Projects Completed 450+ Customers across 15+ Countries 25+ Industries served 150+ eCommerce Enthusiasts Let’s Connect Real Impact. Measurable Results. Journey with i95Dev: Long-term Integration Partners What started as a project to integrate Magento and Microsoft Dynamics ERP systems translated into a long-term partnership for more than six years. Over these years, i95Dev worked with Mossberg to keep the integration updated as they upgraded their eCommerce and ERP systems and customized the integration to meet their business goals and requirements. In 2015-2016, we provided integration with i95Dev AX Connect and customized the solution per their specific operational needs. In 2022, Mossberg sought to upgrade their eCommerce and ERP system from Dynamics AX to Dynamics 365 F&O, again trusting i95Dev as their technology partner. Impressed with our expertise and commitment, Mossberg decided to extend the partnership with i95Dev by adding ERP enhancement, maintenance, and support activities. Key Features & Enhancements Manage Product & Inventory Information Effectively – i95Dev Connect centralized product, inventory, and pricing information in the ERP system, streamlining product information management and driving personalization, brand consistency, and trust. Improved Control – By extending the capabilities of the ERP system and integration, i95Dev enabled Mossberg to control and sync selected products from the ERP system to the online store better. Streamline and Automate Order Processing – i95Dev automated the order sync between the eCommerce and the ERP systems, eliminating manual order entry errors, enabling faster order processing, and improving customer satisfaction. Enhanced Customer Management – i95Dev Connect helped improve customer relationships by integrating customer data from multiple sources in a single repository, eliminating data silos, and offering a 360-degree view of their customers. They cater to a wide range of customers across industries with a focus on quality and service. With a vast inventory and nationwide reach, they ensure timely delivery and reliable support. Their commitment to innovation drives their digital transformation and operational excellence. EGe not only aligned with Absolute Parts eCommerce needs but also provided customization options to suit their business requirements. Automated Sync: eGe automated the sync for various business processes like customers, orders, products, invoices, shipments and other information between eCommerce and ERP. This reduced manual intervention and streamlined operations. Inventory Management: Real-time visibility of inventory by location enhanced the logistics and customer services especially for customers from various locations. chunks.title: B2B Ecommerce Customer Experience - An Action Plan

headings.text: B2B Ecommerce Customer Experience - An Action Plan

chunks.content: B2B eCommerce Customer Experience – An Action Plan Author Category Share Sally’s long week at work ended with binge watching her favorite series on TV drowned in a bucket of popcorn. She lazes around all weekend working her way through her favorite shopping sites, buying stuff she had been procrastinating for a while. Sally relaxed and feels thoroughly accomplished and pumped to start the new month ahead at work on Monday. Sally has worked hard, is now beginning to reap the fruits of a successful business set up a few years ago. She goes early to work on Monday, gets ready to order the customary supplies for the month ahead. So what do you think Sally was going to do? Call the vendor who she always struggles to catch hold of at that early hour? Go hunting in her practically paperless office for catalogs to order from? Or call around peers for help on good deals? For all you know she probably wants break convention. Get over with a simple mundane routine bulk order. Sally will look for that convenient B2B ecommerce customer experience that helped her get rid of her personal shopping chores successfully over the weekend. Will she find what she wants? The rise in expectations of a B2B buyer If you thought that an average B2B buyer today stuck to convention, as a B2B brand owner this is probably your first step towards gross negligence. Forrester said that B2B ecommerce market is estimated at $1.1 trillion compared to the B2C market, which is at $480 billion. The accelerated growth of B2B ecommerce is only justified however; for the buying community here overlaps with B2C where superior evolved buying experiences reign. B2B buyers today are therefore aware; they are clear needs for online simply because they are aware of the B2C space. So now Sally would prefer to ideally help herself online with simple self-serve online portal as against looking calling a vendor negotiating prices and the regular rigmarole from there. A robust B2B portal would help sally find more information, note fine print, research, buy and further manage her accounts from there. All right you do realize that your audiences are out there waiting for you to put up your best show yet. Unsure if you can still succeed? Here is what you may have likely overlooked. To meet your B2B customer expectations and overcome specific challenges, watch this insightful webinar. click here Common B2B misconceptions It is but a fact that B2B businesses are yet to realize the complete potential of ecommerce; now this could be due to several reasons. The leadership rung still believes that not only implementing ecommerce is expensive but all that follows remains complex with costs riding over a projected revenue gain. While this stands at the base what follows are a series of other mistakes B2B brands commit in their endeavor to succeed online. The B2B buyer is yet to mature. But of course you are dealing with the new generation buyer whose powers and preferences you cannot fathom completely yet. But you do know that their preferred method of transacting has surpassed the conventional processes and for the nth time as we insist, they have stepped in from the B2C realm. Bear in mind that almost all the winning features of B2C can be translated into B2B thereby dramatically influencing customer experiences. B2B Ecommerce will reveal the pricing structure. With the growth rate in B2B we have just mentioned above, cut throat pricing techniques margins hitting new lows simply to gain a bigger chunk of buyers are inevitable. While caution to safeguard pricing techniques cannot be compromised, a web store front will not snatch your privacy away. Web stores can offer the option of viewing prices when the buyer logs in. While this not only restricts customers viewing the entire pricing structure, access can also be restricted to showcasing the applicable and negotiated pricing for a specific user. The B2B site can also be simply to allow product visibility enable product visibility for those without a login and encourage them to call for prices. B2B ecommerce does not foster long term relationships Long term relationship with the B2B buyer is conventional; for there are bulk and repeat orders that occur periodically. Forging strong B2B bonds also ensures that competition is not a threat really, with “deals” closed over dinner’s visits and trips by family owned businesses. Web stores can still be transformed with live 24*7 chats, presence on social media or a variety of other options to connect. With this, customer service is a lot more continued and moreover is welcomed by the B2B community at large. B2B ecommerce is incapable of handling custom orders A custom order mostly based on the longevity of the relationship is most often perceived to be against the ecommerce norm. Let us say that you work with a Magento B2B setup, there are add-ons or extensions, tools and variants that can be incorporated. Sales quote for Magento is a classic example of such a tool that allows creation of online quotes straight from the shopping cart. Scalability is not feasible with B2B ecommerce Building a highly scalable B2B platform is more often pushed to the back burner by B2B brands. Brands build shopping cart platforms without too much thought into the future despite having an aggressive growth agenda on the cards. This directly impacts ecommerce functionality at each stage of growth ultimately coming in the way of the company’s ability to scale its platform. Above all B2B firms direct focus on to beating direct competitors, when the actual market is hogged by the massive online marketplaces such as Amazon, Google, eBay and Alibaba. These giants have already established and transformed B2C buying experiences that is slowly steadily catching up on B2B as well. After all the B2B buyer already familiar, they use their sites apps and completely is at home with all interfaces. They know that no matter what his expectations will be met by them. Sally is no exception. Evolved B2B ecommerce customer experience – Here is your 7 point action plan It is imperative to bear in mind and keep competing with your own customer expectations; delivering exceptional online buying experience is that which can sustain your B2B selling strategy. Doing away with legacy tech infrastructure and investing in what will meet evolved customer demands will propel your brand towards a win each time. Make B2B ecommerce an informed reassuring buying experience Your content is indeed the lifeline of your B2B ecommerce experience . With missing information like product sizes, ingredient lists, or demo videos, the user will simply look elsewhere. This simply leads to the customer choosing another purchase funnel outside of your own. Today B2B user experiences mean ability to obtain detailed information and ability to track real time data on products and services made available. If it means deploying a robust product information management system in the B2B portal, it is about time B2B brands thought about it. Free unrestricted information exchange establish trust and then this way the deal can be closed out faster. Focus on offline to online shift Millennial buyers are about efficiency and speed in transactions; the chances of speaking to a sales representative or using a phone to close out a sale is slowly decreasing. On the contrary the chances of a purchase during a service call by the sales representative are pretty much growing. With adequate publicity on the launch of an ecommerce channel, you can even drive your most valued customers into preliminary testing so as to train, educate, and gain valuable feedback. Leverage the ability to nurture leads through the B2B buying journey A typical B2B buyer journey is long and therefore there exists a bigger window to explore potential to sell more to the same buyer in the process. Rich content in the form of informative material related to the product help consumers make informed decisions, establishing communication after first level information is shared helps hit the iron when it is hot. The buyer feels a lot more connected with the brand, the interest builds and also increases the chances of connecting with a sales person from there. Read our blog on how to leverage on CRM for your B2B business . Woo your Omni channel audiences According to MarketingProfs , “98% of buyers are doing at least some online research on work-related purchases that they make offline”. Today the conversion funnel ideally takes off from there, a website experience that transmit contextual consistent and accurate content is therefore imperative. The role of the B2B salesman is not redundant as yet, what is more important and sustainable is the ability to be able to complement and feed prospects into both online/offline channels. Aggregating and organizing data across applications within the business set-up will help establish an integrated system. Now this will enable uniform sharing of data which is crucial to ensure a seamless buying experiences across different channels. For more information, do read our blog on omni-channel experience in B2B ecommerce . Merge your ecommerce efforts with concurrent business processes and teams Working in tandem with all channels and support functions is that which will accelerate growth. The B2B digital channel needs to be structured and weaved into an existing set up such that it furthers the overall efforts of selling. It is therefore important to first review the current support structure, align roles and resources in line with what is expected from the digital channel. B2B mobile commerce Mobile commerce was 30% way back in 2014 and the figures have been growing ever since. B2B mobile commerce throws open a window of opportunity by means of operating outside the usual confines of a traditional desktop browser, brands can belt out push notifications, social integration, and mobile payments also addressing some unique requirements of B2B. Such as say- B2B orders are most often repeats; post the first order the likelihood of repeat orders from the same customer climbs with the help of a convenient mobile app. Usability of your B2B e-store The web UX of your B2B e store is that which drives conversion; failing which most of the time users fail to complete the website action. B2B customers today demand seamless website performance across all interfaces, customized features, self-service options in short a web experience on par with what is found on B2C. Optimized web displays, user controls and proactive upgrades of customer-centric features ( read personalization ) can turn around conversions online. The crucial role of partner like i95Dev What lies beneath an evolving B2B eCommerce experience is ensuring that you function with a seamless IT environment that only drives operational efficiency first. Your existing B2B web store build a unified eco-system for the bottom line- uniform exchange of data across applications that directly impacts B2B buyer experiences. Team i95dev has strong experience and knowledge in the B2B realm as it helped deliver B2B experiences to clients across the world. i95dev has successfully deployed Magento commerce with cutting edge add on functionalities exclusively for B2B. Explore our on-demand webinar, where you can discover real-life case studies showcasing how our solutions have successfully addressed B2B challenges. Click here Unlock Strategies for B2B eCommerce Success Facing digital transformation hurdles, high customer expectations, or intricate processes? Discover actionable insights in our On-demand Webinar Register Now Recent Blogs Subscribe to our blogs

chunks.title: Adobe analytics VS Google analytics – Which is better for E-commerce?

headings.text: Adobe analytics VS Google analytics – Which is better for E-commerce?

chunks.content: Adobe analytics VS Google analytics – Which is better for E-commerce? Adobe analytics VS Google analytics – Which is better for eCommerce? Author Category Share With the exception of gauging web traffic, web analytics have a significant role to play in executing e-commerce market research and assessing how a website and web store is performing. Talking in business terms, it gives you an in-depth analysis that helps you determine whether your online business is giving you a decent return on your investment and bags future prospects for better revenue generation. Every eCommerce business has different data requirements, thus, the analytics tool they make use of is dissimilar. A web analytics tool that serves your purpose perfectly is the one you should go for. This will help you acquire insightful analytics data that will guide you to make the right decisions for constant growth in times ahead. A few of the web analytics tools stand out as they are pitch-perfect in their make, insights, and accuracy. One of the renowned names is Google Analytics. It is an extremely powerful software that is available for you free of cost. The Google analytics offers an intuitive user interface, daily web traffic analysis, identification of traffic sources, identification of keyword research done by visitors, commendable engagement metrics along with a grip on conversions and conversion rates. Such an in-depth analysis of data gives you a sharp insight into customer behavior that helps you shoot your profits multitudinously. However, when it is about E-commerce websites, there is just one web analytic software that surpasses Google Analytics and steals the show – Adobe Analytics! Benefits of Adobe Analytics: Third-party integration support – Adobe Analytics has a sharply defined benefit as far as third party integration support is concerned. It flaunts a broad range of connectors for integrating with various types of the third party and Adobe tools. You have the option of importing and exporting data automatically. The export data will help you measure things like cart abandonments while the import data will give you an idea of the email metrics such as clicks, opens, and bounces. You can make use of this data for efficient remarketing. On the other hand, Google Analytics lacks this feature diversely. It faces severe challenges while connecting with third-party tools, however, data can be brought in through measurement protocol API. Thus, it will not be a one-click integration, unlike Adobe Analytics. Customer support and account management – Adobe Analytics provides you round the clock customer support and account management. In addition, it offers countless research papers, tutorials, and videos having solutions to technical problems. All of it for free! On the other hand, Google Analytics does not provide any chat or support line for resolving customer complaints. Therefore, the customer experience with Adobe Analytics is way more superior to Google Analytics. Data storage ability – For their licensed customers and clients, Adobe Analytics allows you to store data for an unlimited span of time. On the other hand, Google Analytics gives you the option of storing data for merely 2 years. In addition, Adobe Analytics stores cookies for 15 years while Google Analytics stores cookies for merely 30 days. This makes it easy for Adobe to save visit information and customer preferences. Custom Variables and Metrics – Adobe Analytics has the advantage of being extremely customizable. You can create custom events, traffic, and conversion variables. It offers specific information on individual visitors that greatly helps in identifying potential customers such as who clicked on a certain campaign or who bought a product. It allows 75 traffic variables and 100 conversion variables, along with 1000 success event metrics. On the other hand, Google Analytics merely allows 20 custom metrics and 20 custom dimensions. Pathing and Funnels – Pathing is the sequence or order of pages visited by your website users. Pathing is flexible and commendable in Adobe Analytics. In addition, Adobe analytics flaunts custom event funnels against valuable historical data. A funnel is a navigation path that you anticipate your visitors to follow for acquiring website goals. With the help of funnels, you can eradicate bottlenecks in your sales or conversion process. Talking about pathing in Google Analytics – it is atrocious! The Page Navigation Summary report works fine when you just want to see the next page or the earlier one, however, you will not be able to go beyond it. In addition, the funnels are outdated and need immediate modification. An industry expert from Analytics Demystified stated that “ Adobe Analytics has a long-standing history of extensive custom variables, the ability to do pathing on those variables pops up as being super handy when you’d least expect it.” Hits and Goals – Adobe Analytics captures endless hits per month while Google Analytics is restricted to 10 million hits every month. What’s more, you are able to track 100 goals on Adobe Analytics while merely 4 goals can be tracked on Google Analytics. Goals provide critical information such as the sales conversion rates for your website or the total number of sales conversions. Conclusion If a website witnesses a high number of variables and high web traffic, Adobe Analytics is ideal for it. To put it bluntly, mostly such sites are e-commerce websites that demand extensive custom coding so that correct values swim smoothly through an online checkout process. Adobe Analytics offers seamless integration with third-party tools which is extremely beneficial for e-commerce websites as they engage with third-party vendors and take up paid marketing initiatives on a regular basis. An industry expert who has umpteen years of experience in managing and consulting hundreds of online marketing companies and websites with millions of visitors every month and who is a former head of marketing at KISSmetrics stated – “At the e-commerce level, Adobe Analytics is the de facto winner. If my goal were to seriously up-level my analytics capabilities beyond Google Analytics, I’d go with Adobe Analytics. It’s a more complete analytics package that extends beyond the website-only focus of Google Analytics.” Recent Blogs Subscribe to our blogs

chunks.title: Adobe Summit 2021: Experience the Digital Future - i95Dev

headings.text: Adobe Summit 2021: Experience the Digital Future - i95Dev

chunks.content: Adobe Summit 2021: Experience the Digital Future - i95Dev Adobe Summit 2021: Experience the Digital Future Author Category Share Adobe Summit 2020: Recap The Adobe Summit 2020 was a landmark moment for unnumbered digital marketers in multiple ways. It marked a moment of metamorphosis in the history of digital technology. Due to the COVID-19 outspread, the Summit was hosted virtually, shedding light on the urgency for stronger digital experiences. The social distancing policies highlighted the gaps that must be filled by brands in their digital transformation endeavours. The Adobe Summit 2020 pinpointed the significance of supporting the needs of customers in an almost completely virtual world. The free on-demand event established the fact that digital isn’t merely transforming daily lives; it’s driving the economy as well. Here are the key takeaways of the Adobe Summit 2020: Digital meets real – Technology has blurred the lines between real life and the digital world. It is advisable for brands to interact with society at many different touchpoints with the help of their digital tools. Customer Experience is Key – Consumers expect their favourite brands to deliver outstanding experiences at every touchpoint. Brands should analyze customer data and leverage it to improve customer experience and stay ahead of the competition. Marketo Engage – Adobe Experience Cloud’s Marketo Engage united marketing and sales by leveraging big data and AI to recognize the best fit accounts in a flash. Magento 2.4 – Magento announced the release of Magento 2.4, which focuses on progressive web applications (PWA) and omnichannel. It strengthens Magento Commerce by offering profound public APIs and top-notch authoring capabilities. Breakout sessions – The Adobe Summit 2020 witnessed more than 100 breakout sessions that focused on leveraging communication strategies by taking care of sensitivity and re-aligning customer experience in the changing dynamics of the market. Cookie-less future – Google decided to abandon cookies in the next two years, thereby, eliminating access to third-party data. In simpler terms, marketers now must reinvent the wheel and create personalized experiences for customers. Customer journey analytics – It has always been very difficult to get all your customer experience data in one place, stitch it together, organize it, and find an analyst who can make sense and extract value out of it. The Adobe Summit 2020 saw the power of Adobe Experience Platform, where you can organize your online and offline data in the Experience Data Model. Thereafter, you can push over to Adobe Analytics Workspace where you can monitor customer pathing across online and offline touchpoints and measure each one’s contribution to your revenue. Adobe Summit 2021 Be a part of the engaging virtual event to enhance your skills and take inspiration from influential thinkers to grow your business and offer exceptional customer experience. Why attend the Adobe Summit 2021? Customer experiences have surpassed all factors that can be classified as key brand differentiators. In the end, it is the experience that matters! The major highlight of the Adobe Summit 2021 is – Customer Experience. When you prioritize the customer experience in your business strategy, you become an experienced business. Then every single interaction contributes to business growth. Here you will learn how to make every customer interaction valuable. Companies that invest in customer experience have witnessed greater customer retention, higher conversion rates, and increased revenue growth. Enhance your skillset You have the golden opportunity to learn from over 200 sessions and training workshops across 11 session tracks: Adobe Experience Platform B2B Marketing and ABM Analytics, Insights, and Activation Collaborative Work Management Digital Document Productivity Campaign Management Trends and Inspiration Digital Commerce Personalization Content CreationDeveloper Ecosystem What’s more? Get the latest trends and insights for growing your business exponentially. Acquire knowledge about Adobe’s technology vision and strategy. Be inspired to create incredible customer experiences. Get connected with your peers in the experience maker community. Plan and pave a successful career by becoming an experienced expert. Discover Adobe Experience Cloud’s comprehensive set of tools. Gain valuable insights, be familiar with advanced tools and acquire inspiration for creating great experiences. i95Dev – Sponsor Being Adobe Silver Solution Partner, we take immense pride in being a sponsor of the Adobe Summit 2021. We design, develop, and deploy solutions using Adobe Experience Cloud. i95Dev was honoured with the silver status based on technical proficiency and customer satisfaction. Launching EGE – eCommerce Growth Engine i95Dev is more than happy to inform you that we are soon launching our new product – EGE. It is a feature-rich omnichannel ERP integrated eCommerce solution, powered by Magento, for Microsoft Dynamics, SAP, and other ERP systems. EGE promises higher customer loyalty, enhanced inventory management, a single dashboard for storing centralised data, improved customer experience, and higher return on investment. The solution enables retailers, manufacturers, and distributors to streamline operations, offer engaging shopping experiences, drive sales, and establish themselves as a global brand. i95Dev’s EGE solution is easy to deploy, comprises a scalable architecture, and flaunts elastic search along with UI builder and multiple themes. Key benefits of EGE: Increase your sales with its multi-channel feature, cross-selling, and upselling Multiple payment and shipping options reduce cart abandonment Secure, safe, and exclusive shopping experience Seamless ERP integrations enable streamlined order fulfillment, unified customer information, and consistent product information. Advanced B2B and B2C modules Increase conversions with dynamic product catalogs, custom landing pages, and constant innovation. Offer enhanced customer experience with layered navigation, multi-address checkout, auto payment capture, process orders partially, and enhanced flexibility with order edit. For the latest updates on the Adobe Summit 2021, please visit https://www.i95dev.com/lp/adobe-summit-2021/ Recent Blogs Subscribe to our blogs

chunks.title: The Future of eCommerce Is Here: Meet Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service – i95dev

headings.text: The Future of eCommerce Is Here: Meet Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service – i95dev

chunks.content: The Future of eCommerce Is Here: Meet Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service – i95dev In today’s digital-first economy, businesses need eCommerce platforms that can keep pace with evolving customer expectations, rapid product innovation, and ever-increasing competition. Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service is a transformative leap forward—combining the flexibility of SaaS with the power of Adobe’s enterprise-grade commerce platform. It’s built for businesses looking to scale without friction, boost performance, and reduce operational overhead. In this blog, we dive deep into what makes Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service a game-changer for modern eCommerce and why it’s the right choice for forward-thinking enterprises. Introduction to Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service is Adobe’s next-generation commerce platform that brings together all the features of Adobe Commerce (formerly Magento Commerce) in a modern, version-less SaaS architecture. Unlike traditional hosted platforms that require manual upgrades, constant patching, and infrastructure maintenance, this offering provides a continuous delivery model with automatic updates and seamless scaling. It’s designed from the ground up for performance, resilience, and innovation—making it ideal for both B2B and B2C businesses that demand flexibility and speed. Key Capabilities of Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service 1. Version-less SaaS Architecture Forget downtime and upgrade cycles. Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service automatically delivers the latest features, bug fixes, and security patches, ensuring your site is always up to date. This continuous innovation model reduces IT dependency and shortens time-to-market for new experiences. 2. Built-in CI/CD Pipeline The platform includes a robust continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipeline, enabling rapid testing, development, and deployment. Teams can roll out new features and customizations faster and with more confidence—resulting in quicker innovation and improved user experiences. 3. High-Performance Storefront Designed for speed, Adobe Commerce’s PWA-ready storefront significantly improves page load times. Faster sites aren’t just better for user experience—they’re critical for SEO rankings and conversion rates. A high-speed storefront means better performance on mobile, improved Core Web Vitals, and increased organic traffic. 4. Generative AI for Merchandising Adobe has integrated generative AI tools into the platform, empowering merchandisers and marketers to create engaging content quickly. This includes product descriptions, category page text, marketing copy, and more. AI enables greater creativity, consistency, and productivity—all while reducing manual effort. 5. Scalable Catalog Management Whether you manage 1,000 or 1 million SKUs, Adobe Commerce offers highly scalable catalog management. Advanced data modeling, customizable product attributes, and robust inventory tools allow you to manage complex product catalogs with ease. 6. Composable & Extensible Thanks to its modular, API-first architecture, Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service supports composable commerce strategies. You can integrate seamlessly with third-party tools, headless frontends, PIM systems, ERP platforms, and more—giving you the flexibility to tailor the tech stack to your business needs. 7. Enterprise-Grade Security & Compliance Security is built into every layer of the platform, from infrastructure to application logic. With automated security updates, encrypted data storage, and access controls, Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service ensures that your business meets compliance standards like PCI-DSS, GDPR, and others. Business Benefits of Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service Benefit Impact on Your Business Always Up to Date No more manual upgrades or patching—new features and security updates are delivered automatically. Faster Performance Optimized for high-speed performance, leading to better SEO, lower bounce rates, and higher conversions. AI-Powered Innovation Leverage generative AI to speed up content creation and boost marketing productivity. Seamless Scalability Handle peak traffic with ease—scale infrastructure automatically without human intervention. Lower Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Eliminate the costs of managing infrastructure, performing upgrades, and fixing bugs manually. Improved DevOps Efficiency Built-in CI/CD pipeline and cloud-native tools make deployments faster and less risky. Modern Integrations Easily integrate with ERPs, CRMs, PIMs, and analytics tools using robust APIs and Adobe Experience Cloud. Benefit Impact on Your Business Always Up to Date No more manual upgrades or patching—new features and security updates are delivered automatically. Faster Performance Optimized for high-speed performance, leading to better SEO, lower bounce rates, and higher conversions. AI-Powered Innovation Leverage generative AI to speed up content creation and boost marketing productivity. Seamless Scalability Handle peak traffic with ease—scale infrastructure automatically without human intervention. Lower Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Eliminate the costs of managing infrastructure, performing upgrades, and fixing bugs manually. Improved DevOps Efficiency Built-in CI/CD pipeline and cloud-native tools make deployments faster and less risky. Modern Integrations Easily integrate with ERPs, CRMs, PIMs, and analytics tools using robust APIs and Adobe Experience Cloud. Built for Both B2B and B2C Excellence Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service is not just a flexible platform—it’s purpose-built for the complex needs of B2B and B2C businesses. For B2B: Support for company accounts, custom catalogs, quote requests, buyer roles, approval workflows, and negotiated pricing. For B2C: Personalized shopping experiences, loyalty programs, fast checkout, mobile-optimized design, and advanced search features. This dual capability means you can serve multiple business models from a single unified platform. What’s Coming in June 2025? Adobe is set to launch Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service and its powerful companion, Adobe Commerce Optimizer, in June 2025. These next-generation solutions are designed to help merchants accelerate growth, simplify operations, and unlock new levels of performance. Adobe Commerce Optimizer: A Powerful Add-On Launching alongside the Cloud Service, Adobe Commerce Optimizer is a robust, data-driven enhancement that enables merchants to: Boost traffic generation and improve conversion rates Optimize storefront merchandising through advanced testing and recommendations Drive digital sales performance using real-time performance insights and analytics The Optimizer leverages Adobe’s deep AI and analytics capabilities to help businesses continuously refine and optimize their customer journeys. Want to unlock the full potential of Adobe Commerce Optimizer? Read our in-depth blog to learn how this powerful tool can supercharge your growth. Read More Availability and Transition for Existing Customers Both Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service and Adobe Commerce Optimizer will be generally available beginning June 2025. For current Adobe Commerce customers, nothing changes immediately—support and regular updates will continue as usual. However, businesses will have the opportunity to evaluate the benefits of migrating to the new Cloud Service and plan their transition with the guidance of certified Adobe partners like i95Dev. As an experienced Adobe Solution Partner, i95Dev is prepared to support clients through every phase of this transition—from initial assessment and roadmap development to full-scale migration and post-launch optimization. How i95Dev Can Help You Get Ready At i95Dev , we specialize in implementing and optimizing Adobe Commerce solutions for businesses across industries. Our team is uniquely equipped to help organizations transition to Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service, offering: End-to-End Implementation Support: From strategy to deployment, we guide clients through the full lifecycle of adopting Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service. Custom Integrations: We connect Adobe Commerce with critical business systems—ERP, CRM, PIM, payment gateways, and shipping providers—for a unified commerce experience. Migration Planning and Execution: Whether you’re migrating from legacy systems or upgrading from Adobe Commerce on-premise, we ensure a smooth, risk-mitigated transition. Industry-Specific Solutions: With deep domain expertise in verticals like automotive, home improvement, fashion, and B2B distribution, we build tailored commerce experiences that drive results. Performance Optimization: We help businesses leverage the full potential of the Adobe Commerce Optimizer for faster storefronts, improved conversions, and enhanced customer experiences. Ongoing Support and Innovation: Post-launch, we provide continuous monitoring, enhancements, and strategic guidance to ensure long-term success on the platform. With over a decade of Adobe Commerce experience, i95Dev empowers businesses to unlock agility, scalability, and innovation—key attributes needed to thrive in today’s competitive commerce environment. With over a decade of Adobe Commerce experience, i95Dev empowers businesses to unlock agility, scalability, and innovation—key attributes needed to thrive in today’s competitive commerce environment. Final Thoughts Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service represents a significant evolution in eCommerce technology, offering a modern, agile, and scalable platform tailored to today’s business needs. With its version-less architecture, AI-enhanced capabilities, and cloud-native infrastructure, it empowers businesses to innovate faster, reduce operational costs, and deliver superior customer experiences. As the official rollout approaches, now is the ideal time to evaluate how Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service can align with your digital strategy. Contact i95Dev today to learn more about Adobe Commerce as a Cloud Service and how we can help you prepare for the future of eCommerce.

chunks.title: Supercharge Your Storefront with Adobe Commerce Optimizer | No Replatforming Needed

headings.text: Supercharge Your Storefront with Adobe Commerce Optimizer | No Replatforming Needed

chunks.content: Supercharge Your Storefront with Adobe Commerce Optimizer | No Replatforming Needed A Deep Dive into the Future of Composable, AI-Powered, Performance-First Commerce In today’s fast-moving digital commerce landscape, performance and personalization are everything. Shoppers demand lightning-fast load times, tailored product recommendations, and seamless experiences across every device. But if your legacy commerce platform is holding you back, ripping and replacing it isn’t the only option. Introducing Adobe Commerce Optimizer — the game-changing solution that upgrades your existing ecommerce infrastructure by layering it with a high-performance, AI-powered Adobe storefront. And the best part? You don’t have to change your current backend. What Is Adobe Commerce Optimizer? Adobe Commerce Optimizer is a headless, composable storefront powered by Adobe’s latest innovations in AI, edge computing, and experience-driven commerce. It allows businesses to keep their existing backend commerce solution (like Magento, Salesforce, SAP Commerce, or even legacy platforms) while transforming their top-of-funnel experience. Think of it as “ A high-performance storefront accelerator built on Adobe technology — with zero need to replatform. “ “A high-performance storefront accelerator built on Adobe technology — with zero need to replatform.” It delivers measurable results in speed, engagement, personalization, and revenue — without disrupting your existing order management, product, or inventory systems. The Core Pillars of Adobe Commerce Optimizer Let’s break it down into the five pillars that make Adobe Commerce Optimizer a game-changer. 1. Speed & Performance via Edge Delivery Services: Your customers expect speed. In fact, a 1-second delay in load time can reduce conversions by 7%. Adobe Commerce Optimizer uses Edge Delivery Services, Adobe’s proprietary headless architecture, to deliver: Sub-second page loads via local edge networks 100/100 Lighthouse performance scores Full compliance with Google Core Web Vitals, improving search engine rankings Enhanced mobile performance and reduced bounce rates Seamless integration with your current platform Business Impact: Boosted SEO rankings, higher organic traffic, reduced bounce rates, and faster time-to-interaction. 2. AI-Powered Product Discovery & Personalization: Personalized storefronts drive higher engagement. Adobe’s built-in AI and machine learning engines enable: Smart product recommendations based on user behavior, preferences, and real-time trends Predictive search that learns from customer intent Automated category ranking, surfacing high-performing and trending products Cross-sell and upsell automation based on customer history Business Impact: Higher conversion rates, better product discoverability, and more repeat customers. 3. Scalable, Composable Product Catalog: Whether you’re selling 100 products or 10 million, Adobe Commerce Optimizer’s Composable Catalog Data Model (CCDM) enables: Enterprise-level catalog modeling flexibility Centralized aggregation of data from multiple third-party systems (ERP, PIM, POS, etc.) Real-time updates for promotions, pricing, inventory, and SKUs Catalog syndication to ensure consistency across all sales channels Scalable architecture to manage catalogs across hundreds of storefronts Business Impact: Faster time-to-market, fewer catalog errors, and consistent omnichannel experiences. 4. Generative AI for Merchandising & Creative Creative teams often struggle with time-consuming tasks like asset resizing, banner updates, and content creation. With Adobe Firefly, you can: Use AI to generate product imagery and campaign creatives at scale Automate asset edits (cropping, background removal, resizing, color adjustments) Deliver channel-specific assets for web, email, social, and in-store Easily conduct A/B testing on banners, CTAs, and layouts — no developer required Stay on-brand with built-in AI guardrails Business Impact: Increased campaign velocity, improved personalization, and streamlined merchandising workflows. 5. Built-In Analytics, Testing & Optimization Adobe Commerce Optimizer doesn’t just deliver — it constantly helps you optimize. Key features include: Real-time analytics dashboards to track performance, conversions, and drop-offs Journey bottleneck detection with actionable insights A/B and multivariate testing for storefront elements AI-generated performance recommendations to improve UX and sales Visibility into the impact of each change over time Business Impact: Eliminate guesswork, optimize continuously, and act based on real data. Who Should Use Adobe Commerce Optimizer? Adobe Commerce Optimizer is ideal for businesses that Want to modernize the customer-facing experience without replatforming Are stuck with legacy or customized platforms and can’t easily migrate Need faster performance to meet Core Web Vitals Sell across multiple regions, channels, or product types Want to leverage AI to improve conversion and reduce manual work Industries That Can Benefit from Adobe Commerce Optimizer Adobe Commerce Optimizer isn’t a one-size-fits-all solution — it’s purpose-built to solve complex challenges across a range of industries. Whether you’re B2B or B2C, the benefits scale with you. Automotive Parts & Accessories: Real-time compatibility suggestions, high-volume catalogs Home Improvement & Furniture: Visual search, immersive UX, large-ticket personalization Industrial Equipment & B2B: Complex catalogs, custom pricing, large-scale syndication Fashion & Lifestyle Retail: Trend-based personalization, fast campaign turnarounds Health & Wellness Products: Smart bundles, compliance, mobile-first optimization Why Adobe Commerce Optimizer Matters Now With rising expectations and declining attention spans, a “functional” ecommerce site is no longer enough. You need: Lightning-fast storefront performance Smart, personalized journeys Seamless scalability and control Adobe Commerce Optimizer delivers exactly that—without the heavy lift of replatforming. How i95Dev Can Help At i95Dev, we’ve been at the forefront of Adobe Commerce implementations for over a decade. Whether it’s building high-performing Magento storefronts, integrating complex ERP systems, or planning headless commerce architectures, we’re ready to help you embrace the future. And when Adobe Commerce Optimizer goes live, we’ll be your strategic partner in: Planning your composable storefront rollout Integrating Optimizer with existing Adobe Commerce or Magento builds Leveraging AI, analytics, and performance tools to boost ROI from day one Explore Our Tools & Equipment eCommerce Solutions – Build Your Powerhouse Today! Talk to an i95Dev Expert Today Explore Our Adobe Commerce Services The Bottom Line Adobe Commerce Optimizer is your fastest path to a high-performance, AI-driven, modern storefront — without rebuilding your entire ecommerce platform. If you want A faster, more engaging storefront Intelligent merchandising and personalization Better product data management Data-driven decision-making Increased conversions and lower CAC It’s time to explore Adobe Commerce Optimizer .
